Exempt
Why ChaiOne?
ChaiOne is a tight-knit bunch of creative, curious, and passionate people. Here are a few reasons that we know you'd love it here:

title: Consulting Security Systems Developer (C, C++, Java, OS, Linux, Key Management, Security knowledge)
description:
Consulting Security Systems Developer (C, C++, Java, OS, Linux, Key Management, Security knowledge)-19000BAJ
No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.
Preferred Qualifications
Job Description:
The Oracle Key Vault team is a diverse group of talented people who are passionate about doing what we can to improve data security in general and key management in particular. As there is proliferation of keys and other credentials in the corporate IT and cloud, key management is becoming an ardous task for enterprises. Oracle Key Vault simplifies this task. As a product, Oracle Key Vault is a full-stack, security hardened software appliance that manages the TDE Master Keys, Oracle Wallets, Java keystores and credential files. It integrates directly with Oracle TDE, MySQL, ACFS.
We are looking for a software developer to help us lead the next generation Oracle Key Vault appliance. This position requires detailed understanding of the OKV appliance, security aspects of the appliance, involves translating the requirements into projects for the appliance, designing and guiding the projects, implementation and delivering a coherent revision of the appliance.
Job Requirements:
At least 12+ years of development experience in the security space, and:
Knowledge of the key management protocols, KMIP, PKCS#11.
Good understanding of information security concepts.
Familiar with full-stack development.
Proficient in C, javascripts, shell scripting; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Working knowledge of the Database and OS concepts, especially Linux.
Good communicator, approachable and team player
Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.
As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. Define specifications for significant new projects and specify, design and develop software according to those specifications. You will perform professional software development tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems.
Provide leadership and expertise in the development of new products/services/processes, frequently operating at the leading edge of technology. Recommends and justifies major changes to existing products/services/processes. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 8 or more years of software engineering or related experience.
Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Full Stack Java Developer
description:
We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented
Full Stack Java Developer
to join our team in
Alexandria, VA
to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.
Responsibilities:
Senior software engineer with experience building mobile applications using multi-device development frameworks such as Cordova and with native iOS and Android platforms. Experience building rich Internet applications on a Java technology stack. Candidate must be able to work collaboratively in a team environment. Manage multiple assignments independently, and provide technical expertise/mentoring to a larger team. Primary responsibilities will be designing, testing and building end-to-end mobile or web applications (native and/or hybrid) using AngularJS 2/4, Ajax, and restful web services and mobile apps to meet customer requirements and goals. Must be familiar with Agile methodology. Excellent written and oral communications skills are essential for this role.
Requirements
Requirements:
Master's degree and a minimum 15 years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Required Skills:
Native OS (iOS/Android) and hybrid mobile application development experience.
Solid understanding of iOS or Android system/application architecture to include mobile applications, backend services, communications protocols, MDM frameworks, etc.
Strong Java and object oriented programming experience to include backend web-services
Dynamic application development experience using AngularJS 2/4, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, sass
Experience working in an Agile team environment.
Experience writing unit tests for development code.
Ability to work with external teams to resolve testing issues and bug fixes.
Business Tier services development using Java, JEE/EJB, JAX-RS , JPA, JPQL, and SQL (Oracle)
Use and management of Git source code repository
Development of automated unit and integration test scripts
Creation of builds using Jenkins
Provide O&M Support for deployed functionality
Ability to obtain a federal security clearance
Desired Skills:
Experience building REST and SOAP web services.
Experience with following technologies; Java, Spring, JPA, RESTful, Eclipse, SOAP, Weblogic, Gradle, JavaScript, Angular 2+, Node.JS, Webpack, Oracle 12c, Phonegap, Cordova, iOS, Android, Windows, GIT
Ability to write SQL and familiarity with Object Relational Mapping tools (ORM).
Knowledge of designing accessibility / section 508 compliant web sites.
About Unisys
Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?
Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers. As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems.
Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.
Unisys
is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world.
Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at
www.Unisys.com.
Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.
#FED#

title: Full Stack Web Developer - Angular 2+, Java & Spring MVC
description:
Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless ®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.
Job Title
Full Stack Web Developer - Angular 2+, Java & Spring MVC
Mastercard Payment Gateway Services is a leading supplier of online payment services. We are an innovative and ambitious market leader intent on growing our global presence. We follow the best software development and Agile practices, to deliver successfully, again and again.
As part of our ongoing expansion, we're looking for a seasoned software engineer who is passionate about technology and who enjoys creating and delivering successful, scalable software solutions.
Do you want to join a team that is responsible for building a global payments platform that serves millions of customers?
Do you have a passion for software design, development and testing?
Have you worked in all phases of the SDLC?
Role
Designs, codes, reviews, documents and tests software components to a world class standard
Works independently as we all as part of internal and external teams
Finds ‘best fit’ solutions to address requirements
Provides task estimates and level of complexity assessments
Understands all phases of the SDLC
All About You
Strong Experience in AngularJS 2+ and/or React, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, BrowserStack & modern front-end development tooling & stacks
Strong Experience in Java and Spring
Experience with RDBMS such as PostgresSQL
Strong full-stack experience is preferred
Experience in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) and Agile Development
Deep knowledge of software engineering practices and principles
High energy, can-do attitude with a strong desire to succeed
Strong analytical and communication skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline
Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact
reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com

title: Mobile Associate, Retail Sales Multiple Locations in LI East S
description:
Job Description:
Ready to learn more about who WE are and how YOU can have a CAREER here??? Yep I said it....CAREER!
REGISTER NOW
to attend our Virtual Event on June 11 th . Learn more about the Mobile Associate Role & get the chance to chat live with our Retail Recruiters!!
Details:
What: T-Mobile Retail Virtual Mixer
When: Tuesday, June 11 tth (9:00am - 2:00pm PT)
Address: It's 100% Virtual (Join us from wherever you are)
Attendee Registration: http://TMobileRetailMixer.vfairs.com/
Mobile Associate (MA) work as part of a Retail Team of Experts to bring the T-Mobile brand to life. They live and breathe T-Mobile! They're brand ambassadors who create energy and excitement around our products and services. They are obsessed with the connected world and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where technology innovations, customer needs and the Retail experience are continuously evolving. They immerse themselves in meaningful connections with our customers, and their ability to build new and deepen existing relationships is unmatched across the wireless industry. They continuously work to build expertise in uncovering our customers' needs and have a passion to educate, demonstrate and recommend device and service solutions. This role is a learning role, where new experts are working with their team and proactively building skills and competencies, in preparation for the next level up as a Mobile Expert. As a Mobile Associate, you will be required to successfully complete new employee training.
Responsibilities:
Builds proficiency related to serving and selling to our customers, while providing a best in class customer experience and building loyalty by:
Helping customers pick up right where they left off in their shopping journey, whether online, through Customer Care or in-store.
Exploring individual needs and providing hands-on demonstrations of the latest and greatest technology in-store.
Side-by-side selling to find personalized solutions beyond the bare-bones device and service plan that keep our customers connected to the people and lifestyle they love, including anything from unique accessories to up and coming Internet of Things (IOT) devices.
Guide your customers through their purchasing experience thoughtful questions, informative answers and sharing your expertise.
Approaching service and sales needs with patience, honesty and empathy.
Becomes skilled with and consistently leverages digital tools in interactions and onboarding to actively demonstrate:
How our ever expanding-coverage stacks up in our customer's neighborhood, providing them with a lightning fast LTE network!
Why T-Mobile plans and services will let our customers live unlimited, feel the love, stay connected and go further.
How we're redefining how wireless is done, down to device and account inspection, review and troubleshooting.
Completes training on T-Mobile in-store experience, new skills and processes, knowledge of systems and reference resources.
Makes the most of their time on shift, consistently seeking out information between customers, learning about innovations in wireless and technology.
Builds relationships with and partners with T-Mobile employees across channels, including business and customer service to:
Collectively own the customer experience and resolve issues, creating a seamless, run-around-free environment.
Successfully identify and handoff small business leads.
Qualifications:
Passionate customer advocate with the desire to be yourself when connecting and having fun with our customers.
Desire to be a part of the game-changing T-Mobile store team.
Competitive drive and confidence to succeed in a fast-paced sales environment.
Willingness to work alongside peers and store leaders, learning and sharing best practices, while serving customers and providing resolutions to issues.
Effective at balancing customer experience and performance goals.
6 months of customer service and/or sales experience, Retail environment preferred
Minimum Qualifications:
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
Work varied shifts, seven days per week, which may include evenings, weekends, and holidays, including full time training
Written and verbal communication skills
Tech savvy
Demonstrated creative problem solving
Company Profile:
As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com
EOE Statement:
We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Full Stack Developer
Share this

Full Stack Developer
Category:
Development/Engineering

Houston, Texas, United States

Full Time

CGI: An employer of choice
Position Description:
Working as a full stack developer, you will research, design, develop, and/or modify enterprise-wide systems and/or applications software. As a Software Developer you will also be involved in planning, development, testing and deployment of applications as per established software compliance standards. This person will evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, operational requirements, and characteristics of overall system along with document testing and maintenance of system corrections.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
The Application Developer will perform multi-disciplinary including working through the client’s ticketing system and performing various incident, service requests, change requests, and problem management tasks. As a software developer you also perform technical tasks that require object-oriented design skills and system design skills and will work closely with the development and QA teams to ensure that the solutions meet the business and non-functional requirements.
The Application Steward/Software Developer will:
Plan, design, develop, test and deploy full stack application
Test the application and develop enhancements that enable a positive end-user experience while working as part of a project team, communicating progress, technical issues and their resolution solutions
Correct errors by making appropriate changes and rechecking the program to ensure that the desired results are produced.
Conduct trial runs of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct.
Monitor the client’s ticketing tool (Service Now)
Respond to the new tickets as per the SLAs
Communicate and collaborate with various stakeholders including client contacts, internal CGI team and management team in addressing the issues in timely fashion
Trouble shoot issues with the implementation of the solution
Provide timely status to the team lead
Help with the deployment of the developed work
Write, update, and maintain computer programs or software packages to handle specific jobs such as tracking inventory, storing or retrieving data, or controlling other equipment.
Write, analyze, review, and rewrite programs, using workflow chart and diagram, and applying knowledge of computer capabilities, subject matter, and symbolic logic.
Perform or direct revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements
Compile and write documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.
Consult with managerial, engineering, and technical personnel to clarify program intent, identify problems, and suggest changes
Prepare detailed workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and convert them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
In-depth understanding of the full software development life cycle
Fluent in multiple programming languages and must have expert knowledge is designing and developing multi-tier application using .NET, C#, MVC, SQL Server
Experience developing REST API and web services using modern frameworks
Experience using Angular and Node.JS
Experience using different databases including SQL Server and Oracle
Experience using helpdesk tool such as Service Now or Cherwell
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or mathematics
Desired Qualifications:
Good understanding of application management process
Cloud experience. Deploying application in AWS or Azure cloud environment
Mulesoft experience (preferable). Experience either using or integrating Mulesoft integrations.
Python. Experience or knowledge with Python and machine learning.
Experience integrating with third-party applications.

title: Client Relationship Management - Developer
description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
WHAT WE DO
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.
Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.
WHO WE LOOK FOR
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.
Technology is at the heart of our multi-billion dollar business. Our engineers develop lowlatency, scalable, and resilient solutions which drive global equities sales and trading at Goldman Sachs.
OUR IMPACT
The CRM Technology Team is responsible for developing an in-house client relationship application, deployed globally across Fixed Income and Equity Sales. With an increasing focus on understanding and servicing our clients more effectively, the value of an effective CRM strategy is becoming ever more critical to our business. This is an exciting time to be joining the team as we are looking to increase our overall technology investment and migrate much of the existing desktop/.NET application to a modern web stack (Java/ JavaScript, RESTful web services).
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL
Design and develop new functionality within the existing CRM application
Work with end-users to translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications
Manage application changes through the full development lifecycle across a wide range of technologies, including Java, C#, AngularJS
Provide 3rd line support on a rota basis
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
4-6 years of hands on development experience(Java/Full stack) with exposure to the full software development lifecycle
Familiar with OO Programming concepts, design patterns and other software development best practices
Experience with JavaScript and at least one web application framework (eg. AngularJS)
Relational database experience (e.g. Sybase, UDB)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong team player, required to work extensively with other teams both locally and globally
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
C# experience
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.
Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: Windows Engineer
description:
PlanGrid is on a mission to build the future faster by creating beautiful software for construction, one of the oldest an largest industries on the planet. We’re changing that by building tools that automate the mundane tasks around collaboration, planning and version control (think version control for blueprints). Our users are building some of the most amazing construction projects in the world, and our platform is their central information point.
Responsibilities
Building near real-time collaboration and markup for construction drawings
Building slick and responsive UI that can handle millions of user generated data points (like photos and annotations)
Replacing Excel workflows with simple, powerful tools that work great on mobile devices (both phones and tablets)
Build unique user experiences for large scale displays (Surface Hub)
Integrating with existing construction software in ways that will remove the tedious from our users daily jobs and let them focus on building incredible building on time and on budget!
Working at PlanGrid means that you will be supported doing really great work, using technologies you like, alongside peers that you respect. You’ll be doing it on a product that delights users and has had exponential revenue growth from the day it launched. If that sounds like the environment for you, we’d love for you to build and grow with us.
About our Tech Stack
We are building a desktop application in C# (we use the latest version) using WPF because we need to support the user which are running on Windows 7. Aside from this support our main focus will be to use ‘Project Centennial’ from Microsoft to allow our WPF application to run from a universal container and be distributed via the Store on Windows 10.
Core technologies we use (there are many others that we use as well) are:
SQL LocalDB + Entity Framework + Dapper + tuned custom SQL to store our data.
ReactiveExtensions + ReactiveUI for responsive UI.
Newtonsoft, JSON for fast and easy JSON parsing.
WIX + MSI for our installer technology.
However, you will also be expected to work with other teams, not just Windows, and their stack is extremely diverse so you will get exposure to lots of technologies including, but not limited to, Python, PostgreSQL, Mongo, iOS, and Android.
Minimum Qualifications
At least 3 years of .NET/C# experience or 5+ years of Win32 C++ experience
Experience with WPF or XAML is a plus
Experience with Entity Framework is a plus
Experience with Reactive Extensions is a plus
Have the passion and dedication to write highly performant and reliable code
Love solving tricky problems
Team player – you love to teach others about cool new tricks you learned and absorb tips and tricks from developers; love solving problems as a team across platforms
You’re excited to join a team that is smart, quirky & genuinely excited about the magic going on at PlanGrid
Perks
Located in San Francisco’s Mission District just one block from BART, among local shops, bars, and restaurants
Medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees and dependents
401k + Company matching
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
$500 annual wellness reimbursement
Volunteering on company time + employee donation matching
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Dog-friendly office
Catered lunches 3x/week
We provide paid parental leave for both parents
Construction site tours of the biggest projects in San Francisco using PlanGrid
About Autodesk
PlanGrid, an Autodesk company, builds simple, beautiful software that construction teams love to use. As part of Autodesk Construction Solutions (ACS), whose mission is to seamlessly connect the office, trailer and the field across the entire construction project lifecycle, PlanGrid’s mobile-first solutions empower general contractors, subcontractors, owners and architects to provide fast, accurate information to the field. With unparalleled adoption by field workers, PlanGrid is used on projects as the single source of truth for all construction data — including drawings, photos, and other critical documents. As a result, critical workflows are streamlined, efficiency is improved and field teams can take on more work and get more done. PlanGrid’s software and other Autodesk Construction Solutions products enable a complete data set to move seamlessly through each phase of a building’s lifecycle — from design and preconstruction to construction, turnover, and operations. PlanGrid is used on more 1.5 million construction projects in 100+ countries.
Join us as PlanGrid and ACS advance Autodesk’s leadership in construction.
As part of GDPR compliance procedures, we have posted our Recruiting Privacy Notice on our website. Please also note that the advertised position is an opportunity with Autodesk, Inc. (https://www.autodesk.com/), as Autodesk recently acquired PlanGrid. Processing of your personal information as part of the job application process, and as part of Autodesk employment should a candidate be hired, will be handled by Autodesk pursuant to Autodesk’s Candidate Privacy Statement, available at: https://damassets.autodesk.net/content/dam/autodesk/www/content/careers/autodesk_candidate_privacy_statement.pdf.
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Who are we?
Watch to find out!
Koch Supply & Trading is looking for a
Full Stack Developer
to join our IT team working on a trading desk in Houston, TX. The Front-Office IT Team at KS&T partners with trading groups to develop technology solutions that contribute to our profitability. The Full Stack Developer will play a key role on the team by collaborating with Trade Analysts, Cloud Architects, Data Scientists and other Developers to design and develop secure, stable, scalable, and high performing systems that facilitate decision making for our business. Experience designing and developing dashboards, cubes, analysis charts, reports, etc. to provide speed-to-data insight (DAX, Tableau, PowerBI)
3+ years proficiency in MSFT SQL database design, data modeling, and query optimization
1+ years professional experience with Python 3
Experience with MSFT T-SQL
Experience developing software components applying object-oriented designs and practices
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field from an accredited institution
What Will Put You Ahead?

Experience implementing both web front end and back end components using a variety of technologies such as HTML, JavaScript, Python, etc.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

KS&T?
Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.

title: UI/UX Developer
description:
UI/UX Developer
Job Description

A strong focus on both desktop and mobile design

5+ years experience with HTML/CSS
5+ years experience with Javascript
3+ years experience with one or more UI frameworks (Angular/React/Vue)
Experience with Python preferred
Image editing experience strongly preferred

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer - Java Angular
description:
Create the products that are changing an industry.
We never stop working to make investing simpler and more successful for our clients. By promoting new ways of building software, you’ll optimize products and keep our client experience improving at pace. Your work as a Full-Stack Engineer will not only give you true ownership of your products as you capitalize on a Lean Agile approach. It will change the way the world invests.
In this role you will:
As a Full Stack Developer on Vanguard’s Client Experience program, you’ll work on a fully dedicated, cross-functional, co-located and durable team given the autonomy required to deliver solutions which fulfill client needs and drive business outcomes within the context of client journeys. The team will operate with enhanced speed and agility to deliver meaningful customer experiences in a rapid build-measure-learn manner.
Bring invention to investing
Focused on creating innovative user experiences, you’ll continuously deliver imaginative solutions that also satisfy business needs. Your fresh ideas will directly impact one of our strategic focus areas and help us redefine the world of mutual funds. While your analytical approach to problem-solving, underpinned by strong organizational skills, will make you a valuable member of a collaborative team that shares ideas and solves problems in new ways. And at every stage of the process you’ll enjoy many opportunities to deepen your knowledge and widen your experience.
What it takes
Undergraduate degree in a related field or the equivalent combination of training and experience
3+ years Extensive software engineering experience
Strong planning and organizational skills
Ability to implement instrumentation to gather business-specific metrics around consumer usage patterns
Specializations that'll make an impact
Be highly collaborative, a fast learner and willing to work wherever you’re needed on the team.
Have the opportunity to achieve results against goals linked to key performance indicators.
Be experienced with Java, Spring, JavaScript, Node.js and AngularJS.
Have experienced with software engineering fundamentals including object-oriented design, data structures, dependency injection, testable code, and algorithms.
Have exposure to software engineering tools, such as Eclipse, WebStorm, Git, and others.
Write clean, maintainable code, and read code created by others.
Be a quick learner who can learn and develop utilizing a new framework within a single sprint.

3+ years experience in developing sites and services using C#, ASP.Net, HTML, CSS, Javascript, and T-SQL.

eye for detail
.

outgoing, friendly personality, strong interpersonal skills; excellent oral and written communication skills; conflict resolution skills; willing to learn; able to provide own transportation to fulfill requirements of the job; able to work after business hours and weekends as necessary, honesty and integrity, and ability to work as a team with co-workers.

title: Engineer Full Stack
description:
Digital Technical Lead
Cognizant Digital Engineering
Do you love the challenge of bringing teams together to pursue business problems? Do you dream of working with a dynamic learning community that offers the latest knowledge in People? Do you want to see yourself working for a highly respected Fortune 200 company with an established reputation in the Infrastructure Services space?
What you may already identify as Lean Startup methodologies, Utmost Programming (XP), DevOps, etc., we take a step further in order to hyper-focus on velocity and high-performance engineering. The competitive advantage this capability provides is enormous—enabling faster feature time to market, increased customer satisfaction and exponential employee productivity, all while allowing the organization to win in the marketplace by keeping our clients, their customers, and all users omnipresent in everything we do. We are forging the way for what's next in the Digital Economy.
You are passionate about assessing and designing IT architecture strategies for cloud and PaaS platforms that make a difference for users and businesses alike. You have strong design and architecture experience by analysis of existing environments to identify deficiencies and solutions for improvement, excellent communication skills, are technically fluent and have a good understanding of Cloud platforms. You are responsible for executing on Digital technology solution and program roadmap by collaborating with strategy and design consultants. You enjoy working collaboratively with designers and engineers on small co-located teams. You’re passionate about your craft, and enjoy helping others develop as architects. You are comfortable with ambiguity and moving forward with imperfect information. You excel at leading without authority, effectively aligning team members as well as client stakeholders and executives. You judge your success by the success of your team and the happiness of our clients. Work/life balance is important to you: isn’t just something that we want you to have, but something we need you to teach to our clients.
Your Day
We pair, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to architecture that is applicable across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, industries and products. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically work hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.
Required Skills / Experiences
Experience in development/modernization of Enterprise Web Applications
Working as a team, can collaboratively architect applications using modern cloud-native principles
Participated in, and be familiar with, Agile (Scrum) project methodology and practices.
Extensive hands-on experience in PaaS (Cloud Foundry, Heroku, Elastic Beanstalk) and IaaS environments (Azure, AWS, Google etc.)
Experience in designing and deploying cloud-native enterprise applications in public or private cloud
Hands-on understanding of developing using Java to build enterprise applications
Working knowledge of Spring, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, and ability to design cloud-native applications
In-depth understanding of Domain Drive Design, and 12-Factor applications
Experience with relational and non-relational databases like Oracle, Mongo DB etc.
Experience with continuous integration/deployment tools and best practices in DevOps
Demonstrated project management leadership
Past experience working in Healthcare, Insurance or Financial industry is a plus
Excellent communication skills and able to successfully articulate technology concepts to both business and technology audience
Ability to quickly understand business requirements and propose reference architectures and technology solutions. Capable to present options and weigh implementation complexities and risks to recommend the right technical decision
Experience in web-based systems architecture, service-based architecture, enterprise application architecture as well as experience managing expectations when balancing alternatives against business and financial constraints
Desired Skills / Experiences
Experience with both lean startup methodologies and agile development methodologies
Experience working directly with clients and leading projects
Experience leading or supporting user research
Experience mentoring other architects is a plus
Experience working with or inside enterprise scale organizations is a plus
Our strength is built on our ability to work together. Our diverse backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It supports lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our clients. We want someone who thrives in this setting and is encouraged to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration.
If you’re comfortable with ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you.
Employee Status :
Full Time Employee
Shift :
Day Job
Travel :
No
Job Posting :
Oct 12 2018
Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US, please send an email with your request to CareersNA2@cognizant.com
About Cognizant
Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the Nasdaq-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: USJobsCognizant.
Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer, Assoc.
description:
Responsibilities/Qualification
Full-Stack Software Engineer, Associate (DRMS)
The Digital Radio Management System (DRMS) Developer is responsible for the life-cycle software engineering of an enterprise radio management system to allow real world radios to integrate with distributed simulations and VoIP phones using a combination of protocols including DIS, HLA and RTP used in the Navy Continuous Training Environment (NCTE). NCTE Software Engineering provides modeling and simulation application development, live, virtual and constructive systems integration support and in-service engineering support to US Fleet Forces (USFF) and the Number Fleets.
Duties and Responsibilities
Primary development is done on-site with Red Hat Linux 6/7 platforms using Eclipse and/or IntelliJ IDEs to write Java and JavaScript (Sencha, ExtJS) with Shell scripting to help automate tasks and query information and Git as the primary revision control system. Under direct supervision, this developer is required to:
Work with a team of developers and subject matter experts to develop, enhance, integrate, and support DRMS applications.
Assist in the writing and/or presentation of briefings (reports on analyses, findings, and project progress), project or task plans, system specification manuals, technical reports and user manuals.
Participates in the preparation of technical proposals.
Performs additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related discipline
0 to 2 years of directly related experience developing and maintaining software.
Security+ and Linux+ certification will be required if the candidate does not have them already.
In some cases, educational requirements may be adjusted or waived for more than 5 years applicable work experience.
Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
U.S. Citizen able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret security clearance
Understanding of Java design and development
Willingness to learn and contribute to the full software stack, including database and web development
Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to work in an Agile team environment
Desired Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Active DoD Secret Clearance
Experience with Java development in a Linux/Unix environment
Security+ and Linux+
Favorable Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Experience with Java debugging tools, JavaScript development, Apache ActiveMQ, JUnit, Jenkins, SonarQube, Eclipse, Intelllij, SVN, GIT, C/C++, Modeling and Simulation, C4I Systems, Gradle or Maven build systems, HLA and DIS protocols, Shell Scripting, System interface development
Diversity Statement
Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. Alion will provide a reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans who need assistance to apply. Please visit the Alion Careers site for more information
U.S. Citizenship Required.

title: Sr. Backend Developer (PHP/ MySQL)
description:
About Us
Refersion is a 100% bootstrapped and highly profitable B2B app development company based in New York City. Our flagship product is a sales tracking (SaaS) platform in the e-commerce space, and we provide solutions to a large and growing client base ranging from established online retailers to smaller and emerging businesses.
At Refersion, our technical staff believes that software development is a craft. It's part of our culture. We are a small team which allows for a really strong collaborative environment and the ability to build amazing apps that delight the user. A get stuff done attitude. Small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. Our server stacks run PHP, MySQL, GraphQL, Serverless, ReactJS, ElastiCache, and more. If you're an intelligent developer who believes in doing what is best for the product, you'll love our team.
Who We're Looking For
A wonderful and unique opportunity at Refersion exists for a talented Backend Developer to contribute original and innovative ideas to our ever-evolving codebase. Working with our dedicated team and using cutting-edge technology, you will help develop and maintain our flagship SaaS platform, as well as provide invaluable input for the continuous improvement of our products. If you love elegant and streamlined code (adhering to the KISS principle), relentlessly exploring solutions independently, and are passionate about refining and expanding your craft, we want to meet with you.
What You'll Be Doing
Work with fellow developers to integrate new features into existing codebase while maintaining existing designs
Maintain existing codebase while contributing code for both new projects and the expansion of existing projects
Collaborate with QA team to help validate solutions
Communicate with Customer Success team to identify problematic integrations and triage bugs.
Take ownership of and complete assigned Sprint tickets and other tasks within an Agile environment
Help to write and validate database queries for clients to better understand their performance.
Assist in investigating bugs and finding solutions
Remain current on all Refersion features and products
REQUIREMENTS
You'll Need
5 to 7 years’ full stack and/ or backend development experience
Superb and independent problem-solving skills (we love Googlers!)
Superior time management skills
Excellent knowledge of PHP, MySQL, Git, and REST (both design and usage)
Familiarity with Linux/Unix
Familiarity with SCRUM/ Agile environments
Understanding of MVC (Model/View/Controller), OOP (Object Oriented Programming), and other design principles
Solid knowledge of Javascript, HTML/ CSS/ SASS
Effective client-facing communication skills to diagnose, troubleshoot, and explain complex technical problems in plain English
Passion for writing well-documented code
Understanding the importance of development best practices and how they relate to security
Bonus Points
Success at a start-up and/ or entrepreneurial environment “wearing many hats”
Laravel
Experience with serverless technologies
Experience using AWS (or Azure/GCP)
GraphQL experience
DevOps experience
React
Experience with TDD (test-driven development - i.e., PHPUnit)
Shopify/ BigCommerce/ Woocomm experience
Being aware of what you do not know
BENEFITS
We're a small, collaborative team with no investors and a lot of freedom. This means you will have a direct impact on any project you work on. Being a small, completely independent startup owned and operated by millennials, Refersion is the perfect place for a candidate with serious ambition. Some other perks include:
Great benefits: medical, dental, and vision
Generous vacation time
Convenient office location to all major public transportation lines
Flexible work hours
Plenty of office events such as happy hours and learning sessions
Kitchen with unlimited coffee/tea, beer, and snacks
Plenty of opportunity while we grow and scale

title: Full Stack Engineer, Data Science Team
description:
The Role
Data is at the core of Outreach's strategy. It drives our customers and ourselves to the highest levels of success. We use it for everything from customer health scores and revenue dashboards, to operational metrics of our AWS infrastructure, to helping increase product engagement, to predictive analytics and causal inference via experimentation. As our customer base continues to grow, we are looking towards new ways of leveraging our data to save our customers time and improve their sales efficiency.
About the Team
The mission of the Data Science team is to accelerate success of our internal and external customers through trustworthy data analysis and experimentation. As a member of the team, you will be on the ground floor, working directly with the VP of Data Science to define and implement our strategy for delivering data products. You will be responsible for delivering models, data-driven functionality, and end-user features based on these models that will be deployed into production. This is a full stack role that has a strong backend and frontend components.
Your Daily Adventures Will Include
Help define roadmap and implementation for our reporting services that give Outreach users visibility and insights into their performance
Participate in research and development of machine learning features all the way through delivering them into product by visualize insights that data analysis and Machine Learning uncover for our users
Work on implementing algorithms and user experience for our A/B testing system, providing intuitive ways to configure, monitor, and analyze results of A/B experiments
Rigorously measure the impact of your work via data analysis and experimentation
Basic Qualifications
Experience defining and implementing complex projects, both backend and frontend components, including designing and implementing a new user experience from scratch
Previous exposure to data-intensive environments, including data modeling and integration concepts, as well as validation, productization, and automation of ML models.
Experience with charting and dashboarding packages
Comfortable with automated testing tools like Mocha, Chai, and Enzyme
Experience consuming and designing JSON APIs
Familiar with continuous deployment environments
Goes above and beyond to help your team
Strives to learn and be a better craftsperson
Knows which details are important and can prioritize incremental delivery
Why You’ll Love It Here
100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees
Unlimited PTO (and people actually use it!)
401k to help you save for the future
Company-organized and personal paid volunteer days to support the community that supports us
Fun company and team outings because we play just as hard as we work
Diversity and inclusion programs that promote employee resource groups like OWN (Outreach Women's Network)
A parental leave program that includes not just extended time off but options for a paid night nurse, food delivery, gradual return to work, and the Gottman Institute's Bringing Home Baby course for new parents
Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team
Plus, unlimited snacks and beverages in our kitchen

title: SharePoint Architect, Developer
description:
In this role, you will collaborate with business users to streamline, automate, and empower Revlon’s global business. Revlon relies on SharePoint for automation and management of many critical internal functions. The ideal candidate for this role is a motivated and ambitious learner who is excited to work on a large SharePoint farm for a global enterprise. The ideal candidate will eagerly explore custom code and configuration to develop understanding and will not be afraid to improve, extend and maintain existing solutions.
The SharePoint Architect position is responsible for supporting and extending Revlon’s global SharePoint footprint, which comprises several application families, versions, and dozens of member servers. The SharePoint service family is used by a majority of company employees, with thousands of unique visitors each week, and long running sessions with many hits and page views. The SharePoint Architect will assist in the development and support of custom applications that cover a full cross section of the company including sales, marketing, finance, accounting, production, and IT. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of how to support and develop within the larger application stack, and should be familiar with server and network administration in the lower layers, and have an understanding of web applications on the upper layers. This individual will bring value by recommending solutions that drive simplicity, supportability, and high quality user experience.
MS SharePoint specific certifications preferred
Web application development experience including HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript libraries and tools required
Expert level knowledge of SharePoint site administration and security model
Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve problems with SharePoint
Nintex experience is a plus
Working knowledge and experience coding custom components and sites in SharePoint 2013, WebParts, workflows, and ASP/.Net integration
Exceptional communication, documentation and organizational skills

title: PIZZA PERSON/SERVER/CLEANING CREW
description:
Position Summary - Responsibilities and Expectations:
The Pizza person is the in charge of Pizza Station within a convenience store. Do you like working with people, making them happy, and being surrounded by delicious food? Then you might be ready for a Pizza Person or Server job. Your job is to make pizza and serve food to the customer. Pizza Person must follow
Hunt Brothers Pizza
guidelines all time.
Work Oven Station:
Essential Job Duties:
Refill all food station items, etc.
Assemble food product and place items on a tray.
Place food product in a pre-heated oven; remove food product when finished and build to completion.
Place food product in appropriate container and bring completed product to register station under warmers.
Follow proper coding procedures. Check expiration codes and inspect all items once during shift. Pull expired items, document and discard.
Keep work oven area stocked by moving product from freezer and/or cold box to the work station.
Perform the following physical behaviors continuously throughout their shift: walking, standing, handling, reaching horizontally, reaching above shoulder and grasping firmly.
Perform the following physical behaviors frequently during their shift: pushing buttons.
Perform the following physical behaviors occasionally during their shift: bending, stooping, squatting, climbing and balancing on step ladder and reaching below the waist.
Constantly lift weights up to 10 lbs.
Frequently lift weights of up to 12.5 lbs.
Frequently carry weights of up 12.5 lbs within a 40 ft distance.
Work safely with equipment that can create and hold very high temperatures using appropriate personal protective equipment.
Coffee Area:
Essential Job Duties:
Work in the coffee area and observe coffee thermals to determine need for refills.
Fill coffee basket with filter and coffee grinds; brew coffee.
Carry coffee thermals from brewing area to coffee station as needed.
Stock cups, lids, straws, coffee mixers and milk/cream on Coffee Island.
Fill and maintain cappuccino machine.
Keep entire coffee area clean.
Perform the following physical behaviors continuously throughout their shift: walking, standing, handling, reaching horizontally, reaching above the shoulder, and grasping firmly.
Perform the following physical behaviors frequently during their shift: bending, stooping, and squatting, pushing coffee cart.
Perform the following physical behaviors occasionally during their shift: climbing step ladder in stock.
Work safely with equipment that can create and hold very high temperatures using appropriate personal protective equipment.
Other Job Duties:
Retrieve cardboard boxes of coffee bags from stock room and carries to coffee station.
Use sharp appliance to open seal on taped cardboard boxes.
Use cutter to rip open coffee bags.
Take out trash.
Essential Job Duties:
Complete indoor housekeeping functions including cleaning, dusting, mopping and emptying trash in all areas of the store. Work with a variety of cleaning supplies and chemicals. Some housekeeping functions will require the use of a ladder.
Complete outdoor housekeeping functions including cleaning, power washing, sweeping, picking up and emptying trash, and keeping sidewalks/parking lot safe. Work with a variety of cleaning supplies and chemicals, salt, spill absorbents, etc.
Stock shelves with products and supplies to ensure in stock conditions at all times including dry storage, deli area, refrigerated/freezer items and grocery items.
Work in cold box and/or freezer for extended periods of time in temperatures around or below freezing. Stack, lift, move, and empty filled crates. Use a ladder when stocking higher shelves.
Check expiration codes and inspect all items once during shift. Properly rotate product, pull expired items, document and discard.
Use a handheld device to record and use inventory. Include checking in external and internal vendors according to corporate procedures.
Responsible for taking out trash. Operate trash and/or cardboard compactor.
Stocking and cleaning the beverage area.
Must be able to adapt to abrupt temperature changes when moving from one environment to another.
Follow all safety and security initiatives.
Follow all company policies and procedures as outlined in Policy Manual, training materials and other publications.
Provide a pleasant shopping experience for all customers and respond to customer requests in a timely fashion.
Communicate with store manager regarding customer requests and vendor-related concerns.
Must be able to perform other duties as assigned by store management.
Lead by example by acting safely at all times and prevent others around you from acting in an unsafe manner.
Use appropriate personal protective equipment as required.
Follow all current safety standards.
Ensure safe working conditions by maintaining a clean, organized store in accordance to standards.
Personnel:
Advise all the employees working for FastStop of any personnel situations or policy violations having an adverse effect on store operating performance.
Treat all associates with dignity and respect and use proper personnel management techniques.
Customer Service:
Promote and ensure a safe, positive, public image within the neighboring community.
Greet customers and provide an enjoyable shopping experience for all customers. Respond to customer requests in a timely manner. Utilize the GREAT customer service model to ensure customer engagement.
Ensure prompt, efficient and courteous customer service.
Promote excellent service and resolve customer complaints in a timely professional manner
Greet and thank you all customers in a timely and professional manner.
Suggest possible purchases to the customer and promote store sales
Job Specifications:
A. Knowledge/Education/Experience:
A valid driver’s license and adequate transportation.
ServSafe Certification is required for this position
Accountable for large amounts of cash
B. Skills:
Ability to operate the store computer and electronic systems.
C. Abilities Required (work characteristics, behaviors):
Ability to work weekends, and holidays
Ability to work independently
Walk the store: check for cleanliness, out of stocks, front shelves, check cooler, restrooms deli
Communicate with employees, customers and
Know and follow company policies
Be able to answer any questions concerning company policies
Customer service
D. Physical Requirements:
Stocking may require lifting up to 50 pounds
Intermittent sitting, standing, or bending
Exposure to cold temperatures when stocking refrigerator units
Ability to use safety equipment, including dolly, or hand cart for lifting heavy boxes or other store items, ladders, and grills or deep cooking fryers
Perform the following physical behaviors continuously throughout their shift: standing, walking, handling, reaching horizontally, reaching above the shoulder, grasping firmly and pushing buttons.
Perform the following physical behaviors frequently during their shift: bending, stooping, and squatting, pushing coffee cart.
Perform the following physical behaviors occasionally during their shift: climbing step ladder in stock.
Work safely with equipment that can create and hold very high temperatures using appropriate personal protective equipment.
Full-time employees must work at least thirty-two (32) hours, but are to be regularly scheduled for no more than forty (40) hours per week. All hours worked in excess of forty hours per week will be paid overtime at one and one-half times the straight hourly rate. New employees will be on a ninety (90) day introductory period, after which their performance and continued employment will be evaluated.

title: Junior .NET and AngularJS Developer
description:

title: Host - PZ
description:
SUMMARY
Responsible for courteously greeting and escorting guests to tables and assisting in seating, in a manner that exceeds the guests’ expectations. Maintains organization, cleanliness and sanitation of the host/wait areas and equipment.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Sincerely and professionally greets and welcomes guests.
Maintains a professional presence at the restaurant’s entrance at all times.
Greets guests, escorts them to tables and provides menus.
Graciously manages the waiting lines and efficiently seats the guests.
Manages the seating flow of the dining room, including seating large parties.
Genuinely thanks the guests as they leave the restaurant.
Answers phones in a professional manner.
Knows store information (hours of operation, phone numbers, managers, location).
Knows the menu information and daily specials.
Understands the wait procedures and reservation policies.
Completes pre-shift set-up, running duties, and post shift closing duties.
Assists other team members in completing their assigned duties and tasks.
Cheerfully accommodates the needs and requests of any guest.
Responsible for the complete set-up, stocking and service of the host/hostess station and entrance.
Continuously maintains a neat, clean, organized, safe and comfortable environment for our guests.
Maintains and strictly abides by sanitation/health regulations.
Adheres to appearance and uniform standards.
Adheres to all restaurant standards, policies and procedures.
In addition, other duties may be assigned as the needs arise.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND ABILITIES
Must be at least 18 years of age.
Cannot be convicted of a felony.
Previous customer relations experience is preferred, but not required.
Ability to communicate effectively to assure complete guest satisfaction.
Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous.
Ability to promote positive relations with all individuals who approach the restaurant and by telephone.
Ability to think clearly, quickly, maintain concentration and make concise decisions in pressure situations.
Ability to prioritize, organize and follow up.
Ability to provide clear, pleasant telephone communication with proper grammar.
Ability to perform job functions with minimal supervision.
Ability to follow directions thoroughly.
Ability to stand for long periods of time.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
DRESS CODE – WOMEN
Uniforms/clothing must be clean and neatly maintained at all times and should not create a safety hazard. If you come to work with a soiled, torn, wrinkled or faded uniform, you will be sent home for your shift. Management reserves the right to determine if an employee’s dress meets our expectations and properly represents our company. When you are wearing the Jack Stack uniform you are representing the company. Therefore employees must remain in FULL UNIFORM AT ALL TIMES while on company property, whether on or off the clock. This includes employees walking to or from their vehicles and while eating employee shift meals.
Hair
Men must be smoothly shaven.
Any facial hair must be neatly trimmed and cannot exceed ½ inch in length.
Hair must be pulled away from your face and off your shoulders.
No extravagant clips or ties.
Hair cannot be unnatural in color.
Make-up
Make-up must be worn in a moderate and conservative manner.
Cologne, Perfume
No perfume or cologne is allowed as this conflicts with the aroma of our remarkable barbecue!
Tattoos
Jack Stack permits employees to wear tattoos within the following guidelines
o Tattoos must be covered if they can be done so under the scope of an employee’s uniform.
o Tattoos cannot be offensive to co-workers, guests, vendors or others in the workplace based on racial, sexual, religious, ethnic, or other attributes of a sensitive or legally protected nature
o Management is the sole judge of what constitutes unacceptable tattoos.
It is vital that employee’s present a professional appearance to the guests we serve
If management determines an employee’s tattoos are deemed offensive or have a detrimental impact on business, then resolutions will be sought, such as covering of the tattoo or transfer of the employee to an alternative position.
Accessories
Earrings are allowed for women only, and only one earring may be worn in each ear.
o The earrings must be no larger than a quarter.
All other piercings must be taken out while at work (including tongue rings).
o Clear studs may be worn on new piercings until they have properly healed.
One ring per hand may be worn.
No bracelets, visible chokers or necklaces are allowed.
NOTE: Employees prepping food or working around food prep areas also cannot wear rings (except for a plain band) or watches, as per health code
Hygiene
Employees are expected to practice good personal hygiene including wearing a good deodorant.
Hands must be kept clean and carefully manicured at all times.
NOTE
This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their manager.
This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise. Fiorella’s Jack Stack is an at-will employer.
Education
Preferred
GED or better
High School or better
Licenses & Certifications
Required
Liquor Card
Preferred
Driver's License
Food Handlers Card
ServSafe Certification
Skills
Preferred
Adaptability
Attention to Detail
Communication
Composure
Commitment to Quality
Customer Service
Dependability
Detail Oriented
Flexibility
Good Interpersonal Skills
High Energy Level
Multitasking
Organizational Skills
Positive Attitude

Speed
Team Player

title: Pre-Sales/Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Description
With more than $150M in funding, 100% year over year growth for the past five years and a recent billion-dollar valuation, Seismic is the leader in the enterprise sales enablement software space. Using leading edge cloud technologies and web enabled solutions, we are innovating and solving complex problems to help the world’s top companies improve collaboration and content delivery between marketing and sales. Headquartered in San Diego and with more than 600 employees across the globe, Seismic is privately held by its executive team and investment firms General Atlantic, JMI Equity, Jackson Square Ventures, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and T. Rowe Price.
As we continue to grow, Seismic is looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to join our team. In this role,
you will be part of our sales team,
focusing on building out functional rapid prototypes, customized demos, and proofs-of-concept. Additionally, you will help scale our ability to deliver specific customer requests by building out a library of demos that are built on our public facing APIs. You will use your technical depth to understand a complex, multi-tenant, cloud native, SaaS architecture. You will tackle challenging data puzzles around SQL queries and data transformation, as well as some front end needs.
In this
client facing
role, you will be an integral part of demonstrating the technical capabilities of the Seismic platform for specific use cases. You will engage in deep engineering discussions with a client’s technical SMEs to ensure a solid understanding of architectural and security capabilities. The ability to work under tight deadlines is paramount –
this is a fast paced environment working within the sales organization.
Qualifications:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
5+ years of software engineering experience, preferable with some in enterprise software
Experience with object oriented programming (.net/C#, Java, JavaScript)
Experience consuming and exposing APIs and web services
Strong database skills
Exceptional written/verbal communication skills with the ability to sell
Prefer 3+ years in client-facing role.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
The Basics
At a Minimum
At Atypic we conceive, design, develop and market experiences for brands, products & services. Our team is passionate about connecting creativity, technology & analytical expertise with a genuine focus on relationships & results.
Atypic is currently seeking a motivated, eager, and proactive Front End Developer that also has a thirst for learning aspects of Back End Development. This talented developer will work collaboratively with our close-knit team of designers, developers, and clients to develop and maintain desktop and mobile application user interface components. The majority of the position will be Front End work that requires exceptional knowledge working with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This position can grow into a role that would flex between Front End and Back End tasks.
Location Charlotte, NC
Job Type Full Time
Education Bachelors
Experience 2+ Years
The Rundown
This team member should be capable of operating independently, working collaboratively with other team members on problems that need solutions, as well as manage both personal and team priorities. You should be an individual with strong communication skills and desire to interact with both clients and team members in a consistently positive manner.

2 year degree or higher in a related field

Continuously look for opportunities for improvement/efficiencies in the codebase they support

Ability to integrate with 3rd party platforms: Email, CRM, Marketing Automation Platforms, HR.

An excellent attitude and a strong passion for your career!

Existing agency experience
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
MySQL Database Experience

Maintain well-documented, reusable, and transferrable code
Develop requirements and planning documentation
Use server-side technologies such as PHP
Solid understanding of SEO and practices to maximize on-page optimization
Our Environment:
We are a small team of creative problem solvers who work with a variety of brands both regionally and nationally. Our day-to-day tasks include branding, graphic design, interactive design/development, user interface design, SEO, and social media. We have a laid-back environment where we work hard and play hard. Our team members are engaged in a collaborative effort to produce high quality work while enjoying a creative family atmosphere.

Exciting work environment
Monthly Potlucks and Lunch & Learns
Summer Hours - Half Day Fridays

401k with matching

title: Full Stack Developer - Industry 4.0
description:
We are looking for a developer on digital technology to join our rapidly growing team. As a developer on digital technology, you will play a vital role in developing a wide range of our products. title: Full Stack Developer Tester
description:
Overview
AbleVets, LLC is a fast-growing Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) providing healthcare information technology services and resources to help the VA and DoD improve the lives of the people they serve. AbleVets has an opportunity for an experienced, motivated Full-Stack Developer Tester to support healthcare information technology projects for our customers. This position will be based in Arlington, VA.
Essential Functions and Job Responsibilities
This position is for an experienced Full-Stack Developer Tester to work in a fast-paced, Agile environment. The successful candidate will be responsible for hands-on development health applications. This role will participate in the full system lifecycle including analysis, planning, implementation, testing, documentation, and deployment. To accomplish this, the Full-Stack Developer Tester will develop tests based on customer requirements and then code against those tests. Duties and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Develop Veteran facing services using an agile, continuous integration and deployment methodology with the capability of multiple code releases per day into production
Develop a testing and quality assurance plan and provide test reports prior to any launch
Utilize customer approved agile development tools for all user stories and ensure traceability for testing
Follow web application coding best practices as defined in Twelve-Factor app. Code shall be annotated and listed per industry-accepted standards for the given language or framework being used
Create automated test scripts, conduct all testing (including but not limited to, unit, development, performance, security, Section 508, user acceptance, functional, and integration)
Support custom integrations between the application and existing VA systems to support the buildout of additional Veteran facing services
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and at least five (5) years of related experience. An additional six (6) years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education requirement.
Demonstrated ability to manage independently or to manage a team involved in the design, modification, operations and maintenance, development and implementation of software systems and applications
Familiarity with Agile incremental delivery approach which supports incremental development of high-quality, fully tested application component delivery every 2 weeks
Demonstrated experience with React and Ruby on Rails
Experience with automated testing and associated tools
Familiarity with test driven development approaches
Familiarity with microservice based architectures
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills as well as interpersonal skills to interact with customers, team members and upper management
Self-starter that can work under general direction in a highly collaborative, team-based environment
Ability to obtain a Public Trust
Ability to travel up to 10% to customer sites as needed
Preferred/ Desired Skills:
Preferred Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering or other related engineering or technical field
Hands-on experience with the following technologies preferred:
Frontend, UI – JavaScript/HTML5, Angular, Backbone, Twitter Bootstrap, CSS
Backend, Services – Java, NodeJS, Javax, Jersey, Jackson, Jetty, Tomcat
Continuous Integration/DevOps – Docker and Gradle
GitHub and GitFlow
Previous Department of Veterans Affairs experience
Section 508 compliance experience
EEO Statement
AbleVets LLC appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class. AbleVets is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Warehouse-Lumberyard Associate
description:
Paul’s Ace Hardware is a growing company servicing our valuable customers since 1956. If you possess a passion for creating an outstanding customer experience, are energetic, enthusiastic, and have a desire for knowledge, you are the type of person we are looking for to join our family.
A warehouse-lumberyard associate is responsible for maintaining quality service exceeding the expectations of our customers; we call this “Legendary Customer Service.” To achieve this, we expect our associates to provide a friendly environment which includes: greeting and acknowledging every customer, maintaining outstanding customer service standards and solid product knowledge.
Expectations and Responsibilities:
Strong, positive customer service
Participate in generating sales
Handle, stack, load, and generally move lumber and building materials
Maintaining general cleanliness of warehouse and assigned areas
Perform in a safe manner when moving product by hand or using equipment
Participate in continuing education and training to maintain knowledge of products and services
Accountable for point-of-sale and/or computer usage, when applicable
Must be able to work days, evenings, weekends and holidays
May be required to lift at least 10 lbs. up to 50 lbs. and possibly up to 100 lbs.
Qualifications:
Customer service experience preferred
Forklift experience or able to be certified
