title: Material Handler, M-F 11:00am-7:30pm, $15.85/hr + $.50 Shift Diff Increase of 0.75 after 90 days
description:
Description
We collaborate and innovate…
Our North American Supply Chain network brings technology and people together in innovative ways to deliver state–of–the–art products, services, and expertise. Our extensive portfolio of opportunities span from traditional inventory, fulfillment and delivery to specialized strategy, automation, engineering, analytics, leadership, and logistics. Our diverse network paired with a continued commitment to and investment in our people, process, platforms and the communities in which we live and serve are the foundation on which we build our bright future.
If you are interested in leveraging your talents to drive innovation, customer satisfaction, market growth, personal development and industry change in a dynamic team work environment-please explore the opportunities within our world class Supply Chain team!
Primary Responsibilities
Operate material handling equipment to move product within the warehouse
Check-in inbound product and tag product accordingly
Perform various receiving functions, such as unloading trucks and putting away product in the correct overstock location
Maintain pick locations by cutting product open and placing product in primary picking locations
Breaks down pallets of returned product, match item quantity and description to returned packing slip and note any differences
Organize orders to be picked in an efficient manner
Select full case and break pack orders by pulling, stacking and labeling merchandise and bringing it to the staging area
Inspect all power equipment and complete the safety inspection sheet before operation
Follow all of the safety procedures
Stack empty pallets; clean and sweep work area and remove trash regularly
Perform all tasks to ensure a safe work environment
Work as a team member by interacting and communicating with fellow associates in a cooperative, constructive manner
#NAD

Minimum three (3) months related experience in a warehouse environment; or any equivalent combination of acceptable training, education, and experience
Ability to work Monday – Friday (or Saturday varies by location), some weekends and holidays will be required based on business needs; flexible schedules are available
Full-Time associates must have the ability to work additional hours beyond scheduled shift; additional overtime hours will be required based on business needs
Ability to become certified in the operation of warehouse equipment
Prior experience operating warehouse equipment, such as forklift, pallet jack and cherry picker helpful
Ability to work at heights up to 30 feet or more as needed
Passing a background and/or drug screen may be required
Preferred:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED)

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work requires moderate physical effort and use of motor skills requiring manual dexterity. While performing duties of this job, employee will regularly sit, stand, walk, stoop, kneel and crouch. Employee may lift, lower, carry product up to a maximum of 66 pounds by hand. Require physical effort associated with using the personal computer and RF scanners to enter information. Must be able to read and hear verbal instructions or through a headset.
Work Environment

Work in a warehouse environment, which includes working throughout seasonal temperature variations
While performing duties of the job, the employee may operate warehouse equipment
Use of proper safety procedures will eliminate any potential hazards; noise level in the work environment is usually moderate

Along with competitive salaries, generous stock options and the full slate of benefits, Plato provides everything you personally need to get your job done. given our stage

architecture
for our product

development
norms
and
methods
for the team

s code

help
others. We believe that making managers better, more successful, and happier results in a happier overall workplace. And improving that even 10% leads to a ripple effect.
We spend nearly all of our waking lives at work. Let's make that better.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
At World Fuel Services, our employees are the key to our global success.We are industry leaders due to the innumerable talents of our approximately 5000- strong professional team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Full Stack Developer / Software Engineer – SCRUM Agile
Background & Context:
You will be working for one of the biggest downstream oil and energy management companies in the world, a Fortune 100 company with approx. $30BN+ worth of revenue every year. You will be a seasoned Agile Analyst Developer with an impressive track record in solution delivery and day-to-day operational support, within a complex commercial and technical eco-system. You will have a hands-on software engineering background. Although you will have early on realised that you possess those most important commercial business skills and people skills and have the ability to translate requirements into Epics, feature sets and user Stories delivering working software / MVP sprint after sprint. You will be a natural high energy force of nature and help the team reach the stars, helping the company achieve greatness. You will have experience with a mix of both high-end up-to-date technology solutions in an AWS application environment. You will be joining at a pivotal moment in the company’s history as we transform into the number one player in the energy market. Put it simply we will be the very best within our industry. We have a new agile organisation, a new Squad team structure, we have brought in a new leadership team and we want the very best people to come join our work family and be at the beginning of what will be an amazingly fun adventure.
Role & Responsibilities:
Great people skills with ability to work with the Product Owner and subject matter experts to devise software solutions to solve complex problems. Be comfortable working directly with the product owner and at times directly with our customers.
Ability to work with sometimes very detailed experts, stakeholders and customers.
Willingness and passion to learn more about the energy industry and about our client base.
Design Thinking
Understand and strategize, mobilise & help plan Iterations / Sprints
Deliver business outcomes / key results
Elaborate complex business requirements and translate into Epics, Feature Sets and “Ready” user Stories (MVP). Maintain agile story hierarchies
Suggest potential options, recommendations and solutions
Story point estimation
Agree MVP acceptance criteria and test.
Automate and facilitate new Story testing and end-to-end scenario testing
Contribute to Architecture design
When necessary raise and escalate issues and risks. Ensure issues or risks are communicated effectively to senior leadership where necessary, with options and recommendations for resolution and mitigation.
Participate in daily-stand-ups, showcase, facilitate sprint retrospectives, and ensure celebrations
Help to maintain Squad performance metrics e.g. Velocity / throughput, Quality, Change Value, Team satisfaction, Customer Satisfaction, Budget and Forecast vs. Actuals reporting.
Work with the team to maintain Operational KanBan boards, Backlog Lists, Release boards, Scrum / Iteration / Sprint boards, Issues & Risks boards, waste bins, handoffs, any and all BVC’s (big visual charts). Work with team to define VSM’s (value stream maps).
Liaise with upstream and downstream squads e.g. IT Infrastructure squads to ensure customer requirements are distributed correctly and delivered in an appropriate time frame, as agreed with all related Product Owners.
Be a pro-active member of related Guilds and Chapters.
Setup, use and encourage use of Agile ways of working and tools e.g. BVC’s, JIRA, Trello, Slack, Zoom.
Develop software solutions in AWS, Azure and/or within legacy on-prem environments
Skills & Capabilities
Good soft skills / people skills, self-awareness
Good relationship management / interpersonal skills
Good communication, collaboration and presentation skills (written and verbal), short, sharp, succinct approach and a good listener
Excellent functional and technical problem solving skills
Positive, pragmatic approach
Able to manage conflicts constructively
Provides good timely valuable feedback
Strength of character, naturally takes ownership and accountability, is delivery focussed
High energy, high performer, highly productive
Inherent sense of high level of quality
Able to quickly identify and resolve potential performance bottlenecks and offer ideas to fix
Significant experience developing web front-end and service layer AWS Apps with NO-SQL database e.g. MongoDB / Cosmos DB
Excellent problem solver.
Be a pro-active member of related Guilds and Chapters.
Setup, use and encourage use of Agile ways of working and tools e.g. BVC’s, JIRA, Trello, Slack, Zoom.
AWS DevOps around CI and CD automation and AWS environment optimization including Docker Container Customization and ECS and EC2 configuration optimization
Software Engineering Experience (the following are desired though not all are mandatory):
Working in an Agile Scrum team for previous similar types of organisations. Working in a day-to-day Operations context and also new Product / Solution delivery (both Ops and Projects). Experience in delivery of applications using up-to-date AWS Cloud architecture or similar Azure and Microsoft Stack.
Good working knowledge and practice of Agile software engineering framework, principles, practices and cadence of ceremonies and significant product development e.g. Spotify model
Previously delivered scalable, resilient cloud micro services and APIs that interface with devices, mobile applications, third-party services and applications, cloud infrastructure, and integration with other micro services
Worked in teams with mixture of front-end developers and/or mobile app teams to develop product features and services as well as automated micro services and API’s
Appreciation of high quality software engineering practices e.g. (but not limited to) peer design review, pair programming, scalable multi-threaded development (vertical and horizontal), test-driven development, end-to-end automation, source code and version control everything from core services to DDL scripts to testing to CI an CD processes to logging and monitoring to infrastructure provisioning, bring the Ops to Dev creating DevOps (automate everything)
Deep understanding of the test pyramid, unit & component testing, integration, systems, UI and regression testing, and performance and volume testing using automation
Good experience in developing automated QA testing processes, frameworks, and automation strategies in general, using this to support just enough good and up-to-date system documentation
Ability to stay up to date on relevant frameworks, software engineering disciplines, methodologies, technologies, trends and opportunities and educate the wider team
2+ years working in software development environment e.g. in a cloud, web and/or mobile applications
2+ years working in environments creating micro services e.g. on AWS
1+ years working in environments with SQL and NoSQL database systems such as Mongo, Cassandra, Redis. Also PostGRES and MySQL / SQL Server (Transact-SQL)
Good working knowledge of HTTP, HTML5, CSS, Angular, Typescript, JavaScript, JSON, PrimeNG, NGX BootStrap, DB.js, Django Docker API, Nginx, Communication Compression
Good working knowledge of Java service API’s including integration with upstream third parties e.g. using Amazon Kenisis, using Docker Ubuntu, ECS, Amazon Linux
Good working knowledge of developing Python service API’s, with embedded R models using Docker, ECS.
Good working knowledge of Database development SQL and NO-SQL DB’s e.g. MongoDB, Redis, PostGRES, MySQL, AWS DB EC2 Instance.
Working knowledge of Container customization within AWS to ensure high performance, high availability and highly scalable solutions (vertical and horizontal scaling / provisioning)
Full stack capabilities (front and back-end with DevOps process implementation experience)
Very interested in candidates that have either a deeper knowledge of UI/UX design and/or Automated Service API development and/or DB development using MongoDB or Cosmos DB or PostGRES.
Desirable:
UCD/UI/UX Design, AMCharts, Google Charts
Desirable:
Experience with single sign-on, social login, session management, user profiles, and user identity and
Desirable:
Authentication frameworks such as OAuth a strong plus
Experience in above or similar Cloud environments e.g. Azure and Microsoft stack.
Experience in any of the following segments is highly desirable, although not mandatory:
Energy markets (Power, Gas, Oil) e.g. North American wholesale power markets and ISO’s
Commodities Trading & Risk Management
Spot Management and Forecasting & Scheduling
Price Risk Management, Hedging
Customer Facing Technology (end-user portals and mobile apps).
Broad knowledge of Energy Supply & Trading, Agency / TPI and Brokerage business models

BS degree in Computers or Software Engineering

title: Full Stack SDE - Software Development Engineer
description:
Why you should join Groupon…
Our mission is simple: to be the daily habit in local commerce by doing what’s best for our customers around the world. To achieve our mission, we promote a collaborative culture that empowers our teams to make decisions. With a strong focus on career growth and personal development, Groupon is the ideal place to build and refine your skills to take your career to the next level. We’ve got a wonderful office with talented engineers, free snacks, and a great view. Come join the Groupon family and make a difference in people’s lives!
Who we’re looking for…
You are a proficient full-stack engineer who strives to make an impact on our customers. You enjoy collaborating with product managers, designers, data scientists, and other engineers. You are able to quickly learn new technologies and adapting to changes. You are not afraid to share your opinions and propose ideas to ship high-quality products. You are passionate about web development and have the technical know-how to launch services that can scale globally. You are a team player and a leader who is willing to go the extra mile to help others in need.
What you’ll be doing…
You’ll review the feature specs created by product managers, plan and estimate the work needed, and implement the changes.
You’ll practice hypothesis-driven software development by utilizing multivariate testing (e.g. A/B testing) to understand how your features impact our customers.
You’ll produce stable and robust software by writing unit and integration tests.
You’ll participate in agile software development.
You’ll learn how microservice architecture works at Groupon and build applications that are highly accessible, available, and scalable.
You’ll lead and participate in architecture reviews and discussions.
You’ll help operate our services by participating in production deployments, application monitoring, pager duty, load testing, and technical investigation.
You’ll write technical documentation, including technical design documents, API specification, and tutorials.
You’ll mentor others and contribute to engineering excellence.
What you’ve accomplished...
You’ve graduated with BS, MS or Ph.D. in Computer Sciences or related fieldsYou’ve had 5+ years of hands-on Full Stack Software Engineering experience, of which 3+ years of Web Development experience using most of the following:
Front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Frontend web framework e.g. React, Angular, and Backbone
AJAX
Web security
Web usability and accessibility
Search Engine Optimization
2+ years of RESTful services development experience using most of the following:
Server-side technologies e.g. Node.js, PHP and Ruby on Rails
Relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL) and non-relational data storages (e.g. Redis and Memcache).
Optimizations to make services highly accessible, available, and scalable
You’ve worked directly with both engineering and non-engineering stakeholders and contributed to software product development beyond coding.
You’ve written API specification and successfully designed and built RESTful services.
You’ve mentored someone who is more junior than you.

As a member of our fast-paced group, you will have the unique and rewarding opportunity to be part of a team that is tackling the unique challenges of the Healthcare industry, and to shape upcoming products that will delight and inspire millions of Apple’s customers every day. The successful candidate will enjoy building a beautiful, configurable, scalable, and high performant Web App, from the ground up.
Key Qualifications
Solid understanding of HTML and CSS
Advanced JavaScript programming proficiency
Experience with modern Javascript frameworks (Angular, React, Vue, etc.)
Experience with creating Javascript Single Page Apps with cross-browser compatibility
Experience with integrating with RESTful APIs and working with backend team on a full-stack solution

Knowledge of common web services protocol (HTTPS/JSON/REST)
Experience deploying large scale web applications
Aptitude to independently learn new technologies
Ability to express ideas clearly within the team and across departments
Strong debugging and diagnostic skills
Excellent oral and written English communication skills
Experience in Healthcare space a plus
Description
This will be your opportunity to be part of the team which wants to place the patient in control of their Health and disrupt the Healthcare industry.In addition to using technical knowledge to drive features and improvements, you must be comfortable with rapidly evolving requirements, and have excellent interpersonal skills. Success depends on working with cross-functional teams. As a senior frontend software engineer you should be comfortable with integrating into a larger system, passionate about user experience through UI design, and high quality web development.Responsibilities: Designing, developing and deploying a new web application, being part of everything from contributing to frontend technology and framework stack, to use case and data model design. Design and build stable and scalable production systems. Maintaining an intense focus on security, performance and polished software. Participate in the continual improvement of engineering tools and processes.We’re looking for someone with great ownership and a strong practical focus. You will be excited by the prospect of working collaboratively with other groups to deliver truly amazing experiences to our users. You take responsibility; you can demonstrate creativity, initiative, and the ability to work to deadlines. You feel a personal stake in the product you ship. You thrive in uncertainty and strive to bring order to it. You keep your eye on the ball; you build strong relationships; and you are constantly looking to improve yourself and your team.
Education & Experience
BS degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience

e are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Software Developer (Mortgage)
description:
We are on a mission to fundamentally revolutionize real estate in the customer’s favor. We envision an unprecedented and unparalleled experience for homebuyers; through our digital system, customers can go through every phase of the purchase transaction (home search, offer making, getting a mortgage, and closing) in a fast, contiguous, and intuitive manner. Redfin reached the tipping point in this revolution through launching a next generation mortgage service in 2017. We now need you to drive our vision to completion and beyond.
Extreme automation is our mantra. A typical home purchase requires over 30 days to close. Through strategic automation, we aim to transform the entire industry by improving closing times to 7 days. The implications of this improvement are significant to home buyers and sellers alike; consequently, our ambitious goals are met with equally challenging technical problems. You will not only be expected to work on these difficult automation and distributed system problems, but also contribute creatively to how we can delight our customers along the way.
Who You Are
You rely on feedback and consistent iteration to drive development process improvements, build high quality software services, and world class customer experiences
You love writing robust code that grows with the business that is both maintainable and well tested.
You spearhead engineering changes to raise the quality of development across the team and the rest of the engineering organization.
You are a teacher and a mentor: you have the leadership skills (and patience) to improve the developers around you.
When you disagree, you disagree constructively, with respect for everyone else's opinions and ideas.
More than anything, you share a passion for our mission to radically change the way people make one of the biggest decisions of their lives.
Customer empathy: you are a “voice of the customer” and understand how your projects affect user experience
Ability to handle ambiguity, drive consensus, communicate well with others, and resolve conflict
Ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with a geographically dispersed team
Basic Qualifications
BS degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
8+ years of experience developing full-stack, customer-facing applications and has built APIs.
Experience leading technical projects from design to implementation to production
Proficiency in modern programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#
Understanding of operating system fundamentals
Understanding of scalable computing systems, software architecture, data structures, and algorithms
Experience with full-stack web development (your team works with React.js, Apache Solr, Java, PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka, and more)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience on an agile engineering team with a focus on shipping high quality, performant consumer-facing products
Technologies we use and teach
Our products are built with Java, Spring, Hibernate, Postgres, Node, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Kafka, Samza, YARN and various other technologies. We also have a state of the art continuous build and integration system based on Bazel.
We offer
Support and resources to continue learning, a brilliant team with which to collaborate, our brand new office in Frisco, and a commitment to your career so you can grow with the company under a management team that has experience building start-ups into profitable, publicly traded companies.
You’ll get far more responsibility than at a big company, while at the same time far less stress than you will find in a 2-person garage startup.
You'll see the fruits of your labor released to the web every day and you'll share in our joy as we hear back from customers, bloggers, and national media.
A mission that matters. Homes bought and sold with Redfin as of 2017: 120,000+ & $60 billion in total closed home sales
A management team that will inspire you with their heart and soul, and teaches you how to build successful startups yourself.
Amazingly smart and fun teammates to work with and learn from day in and day out.
Competitive compensation packages with a salary, bonuses, and restricted stock grants.
Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce

description:

title: Emerging Tech Software Developer Internship, Seattle- Fall 2019
description:
The Content Technology team is hiring talented contributors to collaborate building transformational projects at the intersection of Content & Technology. We love developing full-stack rapid prototypes to accelerate & power our businesses and guest experiences.
You will use your software development skills & bring your passion for learning new technologies and platforms.
You will embed directly into our engineering team & work side-by-side with lead developers & mentors on real projects.
What will you deliver?
Developing & Coding up rapid prototypes & pilot projects
Research into Emerging Technologies
Software & Tools Design, Development, & Testing
Presentations & Demos to Leadership
Come learn to build products that leverage Emerging Tech like Machine Learning, Realtime Graphics, Cloud, and Automation!

On any given day with our Content Technology team...
Rapid prototyping means you focus on building end-to-end full stack solutions and learn, use, & explore multiple technologies: Front-end, Back-end, Cloud, Data Science and Mobile technologies all power your Machine Learning and Emerging Tech projects.
You’ll be having impromptu conversations about how new tech can be used or combined with Disney services; how it could power new experiences or improve existing applications.
Faced with technical challenges we’ll huddle around a white-board collaborating on a solution or maybe stand together at a desk paired-programming.
As an engineer on a lean agile team, you have a lot of independence while still having senior engineers & mentors support you. Leaders & execs have an open-door policy and our culture is friendly. You walk up to other teams & they’re happy to share what they’re working on.

Passion for emerging technologies (Machine Learning, Data Science, Cloud, etc)
Learning new concepts & technologies quickly
Strong computer science fundamentals (Java, Python)

Collaborative & detail oriented work-ethic
Excellent Communication skills

Junior or Senior of Computer Science degree, Masters student, or equivalent achieved or in progress

The approximate dates of this internship are September - December 2019
Candidate must be available to work full time hours (approximately 40 hours per week) for the duration of the internship

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Basic qualifications
Proficiency in Ruby, Ruby on Rails
Expertise in database systems and SQL
Experience developing rich web user interfaces with JavaScript and web frameworks
BS degree in Computer Science or 1+ years of industry experience developing web-based tools.
Do you want a unique, exciting opportunity to help build something from the ground up? We are looking for builders who are passionate about web design and data engineering to join the Global Specialty Fulfillment team.
In this role, you will be a technical expert with massive impact. You will develop platforms that ensure the information used to manage the GSF operation is reliable, accurate, and consistent. Your work will directly impact the success of Amazon’s fastest delivery offerings including Prime Now, Fresh, and Whole Foods. You will work across diverse engineering/operations teams. You will work on the most business critical system design problems related to data engineering, building high quality, architecturally sound systems that are aligned with our business needs.
Key Performance Areas:
You will create web based, data management platforms using Ruby on Rails
You will integrate with data sources that include: Redshift, MySQL, EDX, Hoot, Andes, S3
You will design robust defect detection mechanisms to maintain data integrity
Qualities we are looking for:
Be fun to work with. At Amazon, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact.
Be data-driven, with high judgment. GSF is building out a new team and this means there is a lot of room for experimentation and adaptation. We’re looking for someone who is data-driven and analytical in their approach, and yet also able to use sound judgement to make smart decisions in the absence of data.
Be scrappy: The GSF team operates like a start-up – we’re moving fast and learning and adapting along the way. We’re looking for people who are willing to dive in and solve a variety of problems and own the solution end-to-end.
Preferred qualifications
Proficiency in SQL
Experience in Linux/Unix
Knowledge of modern version control systems such as Git

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Job Description
As a full stack developer, you will use the latest tools and technologies available to deliver state-of-the-art software in the Analytics and Insights squad as part of a growing organization aligned with IBM's Cognitive Applications business unit. You will work in a collaborative team environment to deliver on multiple projects to support IBM's Marketing business including Ruby and Pearl. 3+ years of developing web applications using React Programming Framework, NodeJS, Spring MVC, Java Programming Language, JavaScript Programming Language, HTML5, CSS.

description:

title: Full Stack Developer I - Security
description:
Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!
About Our Team
The BIG-IQ product is designed to run F5 network devices both on premises, and in the cloud. We help our customers build, scale and secure their applications by providing a RESTful API and GUI interface for running all of their F5 Devices. As deployments continue to expand, handling these F5 devices becomes critical to efficiently and cost-effectively running the application delivery infrastructure. The BIG-IQ Security team is tasked to support features on F5’s security product line of SSL Orchestrator, Access Policy Manager and Advanced Firewall Manager. Developers on our team have an opportunity to demonstrate their wide range of development skills to meet the customer’s security needs.
Position Summary
F5 is looking for an engineer who enjoys challenges and dives in where the team needs them.This position is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of key product components. In addition, you will perform as an individual contributor and collaborate with peers. You will work on security products such as Firewalls, SSL decryption and Access that help customers build a secure environment. Next generation application management and analytics will also be the areas that you will work on.
Primary Responsibilities
Design, implement and test components of BIG-IQ
Research, investigate and define new areas of technology to improve existing products or new product directions
Contribute to software designs
Collaborate with team members and partners
Learn quickly in a hands-on environment
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
You have excellent analytic / trouble-shooting, and debugging skills
You have shown excellence in written and verbal communications
You have a sense of ownership over the features you deliver
You are an excellent teammate
Not Required, Nice to Have
An understanding of UI design patterns such as MVC and relating those concepts to existing frameworks.
Familiarity with the anatomy of RESTful web applications, from browser to server to the database.
The technologies used are AngularJS, Java8, MongoDB, and JavaScript but experience using these exact technologies is not required.
Qualifications
Requires 0-2 years’ experience designing, developing and debugging software.
BS/BA in Computer Science/related field or equivalent work experience
Equal

title: Forklift Operator
description:
Forklift Operator
Primary Responsibilities
This is a seasonal position scheduled from 7:00am - 3:00pm, Monday through Friday.
Operate material handling equipment to move product within the warehouse
Check-in inbound product and tag product accordingly
Perform various receiving functions, such as unloading trucks and putting away product in the correct overstock location
Maintain pick locations by cutting product open and placing product in primary picking locations
Breaks down pallets of returned product, match item quantity and description to returned packing slip and note any differences
Organize orders to be picked in an efficient manner
Select full case and break pack orders by pulling, stacking and labeling merchandise and bringing it to the staging area
Inspect all power equipment and complete the safety inspection sheet before operation
Follow all of the safety procedures
Stack empty pallets; clean and sweep work area and remove trash regularly
Perform all tasks to ensure a safe work environment
Work as a team member by interacting and communicating with fellow associates in a cooperative, constructive manner
Basic Requirements:
Minimum three (3) months related experience in a warehouse environment; or any equivalent combination of acceptable training, education, and experience
Ability to work Monday – Friday (or Saturday varies by location), some weekends and holidays will be required based on business needs; flexible schedules are available
Full-Time associates must have the ability to work additional hours beyond scheduled shift; additional overtime hours will be required based on business needs
Ability to become certified in the operation of warehouse equipment
Prior experience operating warehouse equipment, such as forklift, pallet jack and cherry picker helpful
Ability to work at heights up to 30 feet or more as needed
Passing a background and/or drug screen may be required
Preferred:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work requires moderate physical effort and use of motor skills requiring manual dexterity. While performing duties of this job, employee will regularly sit, stand, walk, stoop, kneel and crouch. Employee may lift, lower, carry product up to a maximum of 66 pounds by hand. Require physical effort associated with using the personal computer and RF scanners to enter information. Must be able to read and hear verbal instructions or through a headset.
Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Work in a warehouse environment, which includes working throughout seasonal temperature variations
While performing duties of the job, the employee may operate warehouse equipment
Use of proper safety procedures will eliminate any potential hazards; noise level in the work environment is usually moderate

title: FULL STACK ENGINEER
description:
We are seeking a forward-thinking senior software engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a passionate thought-leader that is adept at creating elegant, future-facing experiences, and technologies. They will be developing technology solutions, working closely with a variety of stakeholders.
About You

Paid time off and sick leave

title: Interactive Developer
description:
Overview
“Do you speak people?”
It’s a language many healthcare companies have forgotten - a simple clear way to communicate great ideas that break through because everyone can understand it. No Jargon. No lingo. No catch phrase of the day. We are GSW and speaking people is at the core of everything we do. We are a healthcare advertising agency that thinks just a bit differently, works just a bit closer and dives just a bit deeper. And because we talk to each other like people, instead of a corporate machine, we come up with great ideas that talk to clients and customers on the most effective level of all – the human level.
Speaking people isn’t easy. But if you can do it, we need to talk.
Responsibilities
An Interactive Developer will work closely with tech leads, project management and the creative team to execute pixel perfect front-end builds making key decisions on Javascript architecture, CSS strategy, HTML5/CSS3 degradation, web fonts, social networking integration, html best practices and responsive design.
This position will focus on front-end development, and as such the candidate should have a solid working knowledge and ability to execute on modern web frameworks such as Bootstrap/Foundation & boilerplate. Along with that, having expertise in leveraging grunt/gulp build scripts are an absolute must.
LAMP/.NET full-stack experience is highly desirable but not a must-have requirement.
The candidate possesses good verbal and written communication skills and demonstrates a talent for teamwork and collaboration. A desire and excitement to explore new technology is a must.
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree. Computer Science Degree Preferred, or comparable experience
3-5 years’ experience, preferably at an advertising agency
Expert in OO JS, HTML, CSS3, mobile best practices, social media integration.
Experienced in using LESS/SASS, leveraging gulp/grunt for builds.
Expertise in working with GIT, both on an individual level and with teams.
Experience integrating with a CMS (wordpress, drupal, sitecore)

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
Full Stack Java Developer
BASIC PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF POSITION
Our client is looking for a Full Stack Java Developer with 4 - 5 years of total experience. This role will need to create Java based solutions by developing, implementing, and maintaining Java components and interfaces. The best candidate for this position would have a solid background and have deep knowledge in Java, as well as familiar technologies, including:
Spring Framework (including Spring Boot)
Hibernate
RESTful API Development
Kafka
Java Editor, such as Eclipse or Intellij
Automated build tools, such as Maven or Gradle
Additionally, as a full stack developer, we're also looking for candidates that are strong in backend development, including the use of SQL. On the frontend side, we prefer to hire a Java developer that is comfortable with JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3. Additionally, we're looking for someone that has some experience with:
React
Redux
React-Bootstap
GraphQL (is a plus)
Redis (is a plus)
Also, thorough experience in working on an Agile/Scrum team is required. This candidate should be familiar with all of the Scrum principles and practices and how they can be applied in an Agile team. This candidate should also be familiar and has participated in Agile/Scrum ceremonies.
We're now in the process of creating our Continuous Integration and Deployment/Delivery pipeline. Therefore, any past experience in using tools such as Jenkins, Nexus/Artifactory, Puppet/Chef would be advantageous.
A plus to have working experience with UNIX or AIX, WebSphere Application Server, WebSphere Portal, Message Broker, MQ, DB2, Photoshop, visual and web site design, and development experience with mobile devices such iOS and Android.
Support for analysis, design, application development and implementation of in-house web-based computing applications
Support for analysis, design and implementation of third-party web-based computing solutions
Support for middleware software necessary to operations of the Link server and applications environment
Finally, experience in either Azure or AWS cloud environments would be helpful and a plus, since we're in the middle of a major transformation and migration to the cloud.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Solid knowledge in Java 8 (including Lambda Expressions, Java Stream API, Default and Static Methods in Interfaces)
Develop using Object Oriented Programming design principles and practices
Solid command of Linux O/S
Understand and interpret design patterns
Utilize best practices and coding standards
Implement unit tests for all his/her code
Refactor code until all security violations or warnings are corrected
Work within Agile/Scrum teams and support PMO in completing projects requested by our business units
Continuously learn new technologies and ideas, and share knowledge with your team
Mentor other junior personnel as needed
Strong verbal and written communications skills and the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Developing in a Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment/Delivery, and Test-Driven Development environment is a plus
Strong knowledge of the interworking of Web applications and relational databases
Participate in and evaluate proof-of-concepts for server, storage, network, and security technologies to support the cloud infrastructure
Create automated processes using well-known languages and frameworks such as Maven, Gradle or Ant
Understanding of application, server, and network security and compliance requirements
Demonstrate experience in developing high quality, enterprise scale IT systems or Software projects.
Analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality.
Designs and develops user interfaces to internet/intranet applications by setting expectations and features priorities throughout development life cycle; help to determine design methodologies and tool sets; complete programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests.
Recommends system solutions by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development and purchase alternatives.
Completes applications development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.
Supports users by developing documentation and assistance tools.
Updates job knowledge by researching new internet/intranet technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
B.S/M.S. in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering or equivalent technical or management training and experience
Certificate in Java is a plus.
Certification in either Azure or AWS is a plus.
Knowledge of containers and docker is a plus.
Experience working in an agile team.
Good skills to coach team cloud technologies.
Strong knowledge of network theory, rules, practices, and principles.
Know about the value of metrics and incremental delivery.
Knowledge about tasks, backlog tracking, burndown metrics, velocity, user stories etc.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to effectively work in a team environment characterized by rapid change and high availability targets
LOCATION:
Coppell, TX

title: Software Engineer, Front End
description:
In school or graduated within last 9 months? We encourage you to apply to openings on the Student Jobs site
Our engineering teams bring the best of Google to our users around the world with high-impact, innovative work. Learn about career opportunities in
Bangalore
and
Tokyo
today.
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations:
Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; San Bruno, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of work experience.
Experience in JavaScript, and one or more programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, Python or Go.
Experience with front end technologies and/or front end frameworks.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience developing user-facing software.
Experience with the latest and greatest web standards, including HTML5 and CSS3.
Knowledge of web libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, Polymer, Closure or Backbone.
Strong sense of web design and attuned to the fundamentals of user experience.
Familiarity with the whole web stack, including protocols and web server optimization techniques.
An understanding of the principles of accessibility and can build products that are accessible to users with disabilities.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
Do you want to help Google build next-generation web applications like Inbox, Gmail, Google Search, Google Maps and more? As a Front End Software Engineer at Google, you will specialize in building responsive and elegant web applications that scale to millions of users in dozens of languages.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Software Systems Engineer
description:
Must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder
Estimated duration of 18 months with the potential for extension or conversion.
W2 with full benefits
Customer and contract specific training will be required and provided.
Travel required.
Labor Category: Software Systems Engineer IV
==
Job Description:
Will be a member of the Ground Data System (GDS) Integration, Test, and Deployment (ITD) Group (394E), which is part of the Mission Systems Engineering Section (394) and will report to the 394E Technical Group Supervisor.
Will work as an ITD engineer as part of the Ground Systems Engineering team as part of the Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) Test Team. The Ground System is an integrated system of computer hardware, ground software, facilities, networks, and IT infrastructure used to support and operate a Mission Operation System on JPL flight-projects. The GDS supports all phases of the mission including design, development, test, and operations. GDS ITD group members are typically multi-disciplined engineers with knowledge of computer hardware, software, and various areas of Information Technology such as networking, databases, systems administration, and cyber security. We implement, test, and deploy the GDS designs and visions of GDS system-engineers and architects. Our group members are practitioners of verification and validation, and we ensure that GDS subsystems integrate with each other through their interfaces, the end-to-end GDS provides all the functional capabilities to support all flightproject use-case scenarios, and the GDS operates reliably while meeting all performance and usability expectations. Our group members are also responsible for planning, scheduling, and leading the coordinated effort of deploying and configuring the integrated and tested GDS into flight-project production environments. We are also responsible for supporting our GDS user community and production environments, which can both present a myriad of technical challenges thus requiring our group members to have excellent problem-solving, root cause analysis, communication, interpersonal, and broad technical skills. Our group members interface with a wide range of engineers such as system engineers, developers, system administrators, network engineers, configuration management engineers, spacecraft engineers, science users, managers, and all the users of the Ground System.
This position is ideal for an energetic and savvy multi-disciplined engineer who works well in a team-based collaborative environment. This is a position for someone who is customer-focused, reacts well to changes, can work independently or with teams and is able to multi-task on multiple products and projects. A passion or curiosity for space is also a big plus.
Required Skills:
Must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder
Offer contingent on ability to successfully pass a background check and drug screen
Background in Software System Testing and Ground Systems, or related technical discipline with work or intern history at JPL
Knowledge and work experience in one or more of the following areas: software engineering, systems integration, software architecture, systems engineering, software and/or system testing, Information Security, full stack development, systems release and deployment engineering, web based software development, data analysis, and production operations support.
Knowledge of Unix/Linux environments
Excellent coding and scripting skills in languages such as Java, shell, Python, and Perl
Good knowledge of Network and Systems technology
Knowledge of Operating Systems and Computer Systems Security practices
Analytical and troubleshooting skills with extensive problem-solving experience in a distributed unix/linux environment
Desired Skills:
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to team with multiple external interfaces such as managers, leads, developers, QA engineers, systems engineers, and others
Experience working in a team environment
Experience in software testing and testbed activities
Experience in operations monitoring tools and infrastructure
Knowledge and experience in the area of cyber and information security
Knowledge of applicable Jet Propulsion Laboratory policies and procedures, NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations

title: SQL Server Engineer
company: Jet & The Walmart eCommerce Family of Brands
description:
The Data platforms team at Jet is looking for an exceptionally talented SQl Server Engineer with an outstanding track record reflecting achievements and skills in improving the database infrastructure from the ground up. So, if you are passionate about databases, (SQL Server in general), performance tuning, governance, cloud, big data and can show us how we can generate more engineering throughput then we would love to talk to you. We are ideally looking for an engineer who is not only talented and skill full on the production dba side of things but is also passionate about the performance tuning, scalability, architecture, automation and process improvement side of things. We would love to talk to candidates with experience on very large Data sets.
Responsibilities
Play a pivotal design and hands on role to improve the DB infrastructure in a project oriented work environment.
Improve and tune inefficient workloads hitting our Big Data stack (SQL Server, Hive and Presto)
Implement controls, policies, processes and best practices in the database engineering
Work on interesting and complex Performance problems.
Mitigate Risks in our database infrastructure by developing the best in class tools and processes.
Help us improve our database deployment and change management process.
Provide reliable and efficient DBA services as part of the database team.
Be a mentor.
Position Requirements and Skills
BS Degree in one of the following subject areas: Computer Science, Information Technology, Math or related technical field preferred.
5+ years as a Database Technologist with Database Administration (SQL Server 2008R2/12/16/17), database engineering and development experience.
Hands on Performance tuning Accomplishments and Advance tuning skills on the SQL Server Platform or Hive in Large data environments.
Proven experience in improving the database infrastructure from the ground up. This could include automation, consolidation, taking out redundant tasks, designing and implementing projects to facilitate governance and risk mitigation for e.g. auditing, policies enforcement, availability, monitoring, maintenance, dba best practices, automatic checks and balances, central reporting, compliance, database deployments etc.
Strong knowledge of SQL server Internals and best practices.
Experience and Knowledge in the Big Data stack, Hadoop Administration, Hive tuning, NoSQL databases will be highly desirable.
Prefer experience in DR/HA. Hands on skills in setting up and managing Always On, Mirroring, Replication, Log-shipping.
Hands on skills in SQL/TSQL and in at least one scripting language.
Strong Plus. Experience using Visual Studio (Database project) or some other best in class database versioning and automatic build and integration tool.
Database design (Logical and physical) and development experience (to go with DBA skills) will be sweet!!
Experience with custom or third-party Performance Monitoring tools
Good interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Technical documentation skills
Self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail, open to feedback, Adaptable
Proven experience in trouble shooting, problem determination and rapid problem resolution

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
:
Pricing and options team is seeking a full stack Software Engineer to join our mission. In this role, you will be integral to a small but growing team focused on developing tools and back end services, in the areas of managing pricing and vehicle configurations worldwide. This will include implementing web services, creating tools for business users, interacting with various systems such as pricing, options management, customer centric tools, order management, and others.
Responsibilities
Build and enhance back end services to enable awesome, end to end, web experiences for our customers, balancing usability with functionality
Design, code, test, and document programs and sub-systems while identifying multiple solutions to complex problems
Define optimal system performance at scale and at different layers while using system profiling tools and stress testing to find and fix weak spots
Implement continuous integration, regression and deployment, while maintaining the existing system and codebase
Design and build scalable, high-availability mission-critical systems and APIs.
Ensure feature quality through extensive testing (unit, integration, functional, performance and regression) with a focus towards automation
Demonstrate advanced understanding of software development and research tools required to support high volume transactions
Be nimble and react quickly to changing business conditions and requirements
Work with product managers, content producers, QA engineers and release engineers to own your solution from development to production

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent with prior industry experience.
4+ years of experience with Bachelor’s degree or 2+ years of experience with Masters degree or equivalent developing enterprise scale web applications or other evidence of exceptional ability
Experience with micro-services architectures, Docker eco-system with hands-on expertise in developing APIs
Solid understanding of fundamental web technologies such as HTTP, REST, AJAX and JSON.
Hands-on design and development for customer facing applications that require high availability, concurrency for a large global user base
Expertise in javascript, Node.js, scripting.
Strong in OOP Methodology, expertise in creating RESTful web services.
Strong SQL Experience (eg MySQL, MSSQL), experience in NOSQL databases like MongoDB/ Cassandra
Experience with cloud deployments, like AWS, Azure
Experience with Unit Testing Methodologies and Tools (JUnit or similar)
· Experience with Messaging frameworks (ActiveMQ or RabbitMQ or Kafka) · Knowledge of different caching strategies, performance tuning, transaction management across systems and messaging systems
Apply
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

title: Fork Lift Operator
description:
Job Overview
Forklift Operator
The Forklift Operator is responsible for loading, unloading, staging, pulling and distributing pallets of Keurig Dr Pepper product supplies while meeting productivity requirements; as well as checking in trucks, repacking warehouse damage, ordering wraps, putting away returns between other general warehouse duties.
Shift:
1st Shift - Tuesday to Saturday from 7:30am until finish
Pay:
$14.70 per hour
Position Responsibilities
Load and unload trucks.
Lift, carry, pick, and stack materials.
Supply production line with empty containers.
Remove full product from palletizer to staging area.
Supply packaging material, cartons and hulls to line as needed.
Spot trailers as directed.
Maintain pallet supply for palletizer.
Rotate floor stock by moving oldest product first.
Perform general housekeeping duties in the warehouse or production area and duties as assigned.
Available to work all shifts, weekends and overtime.
Follow all safety procedures and adhere to all company policies and procedures, including the safe operation of equipment and help to maintain a safe, clean work environment to include general housekeeping warehouse duties.
#CB
Requirements
High school diploma or general equivalency diploma (GED)
1 year of sit down forklift operation experience
Lift, push, and pull a minimum of 50 pounds repeatedly
Company Overview & EEO Statement
Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.
Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.
Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
Candidates must be able to pass a background check and drug test, as applicable for the role.

description:

We are looking for a Full Stack Java Developer. They will be spending 70% of their time on the front end working with JavaScript and 30% working with core Java. Keys to the Position:

title: Software Engineer, Android Applications
description:
In school or graduated within last 9 months? We encourage you to apply to openings on the Student Jobs site
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of relevant work experience in software development.
Experience building Android applications using Java/C++
Preferred qualifications:
4 years relevant work experience in software development.
1 year of Android application development experience.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++, C#, Python, JavaScript, Go, Objective-C, Swift.
Knowledge of the Android SDK performance tools and optimization techniques.
Interest and ability to learn other programming languages as needed.
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to handle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
Since its inception, Google has built products that change the way people all over the world live and access information - looking up recipes, finding their favorite song, turn-by-turn directions, checking their email, and so much more. How and where people view this information continues to change as the world becomes an increasingly mobile place.
As an Android Applications Software Engineer, you’ll drive new innovations and build beautiful user experiences on the largest mobile platform in the world. You’ll work with world-class mobile developers and resources to drive the next generation of apps at Google. Whether building native applications on Google’s core products and services - Search, Gmail, YouTube - or pioneering new visions - like Android Auto, Android Things, Android Security, Android Platform, Google Now on Tap, Android Wear, Cardboard - you’ll impact people’s lives wherever they interact with our products - in their homes, on the go, or someplace in between!
You will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. You might design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s products.
Build the libraries and frameworks that support large, complex web applications like Gmail, Google Search and Google Maps.
Write scalable, performant server-side code. Build on top of our infrastructure to create the services that support an amazing mobile experience.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

As a Full stack Software Engineer, you’ll be embedded on a development team where you can work on the next generation of cloud software. In this highly-collaborative environment, you will have the opportunity to grow as a software engineer.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Business Summary
In VMware End User Computing (EUC), we build extensible solutions that simplify and automate the employees' digital experience to help them achieve more. Our Workspace ONE platform provides every employee with the agility of being connected to the business from any device, on any Cloud, at any time. At our core, we strive to enable our customer's to transition their core business operations and technology closer to their workforce; at the edge, and increasingly mobile. We bridge the gap between compliance regulations and productivity through simplifying the employee experience, allowing enterprises to empower their end-users while ensuring best-in-class security. We are passionate about our customers, and with over 60,000 of them globally, we have consistently maintained the industry leader position in our market.
Job Role
As a part of the Workspace ONE UEM Core Platform team, you will be joining a group of passionate innovators responsible for the "backbone" of our product and an integral piece of our Workspace ONE platform. You will be tasked with challenging architectural problems; from highly scalable cloud-native micro-services - to on-premise deployable infrastructure. You will be an active and integral member of the development team throughout the entire product development cycle and be involved in initiatives spanning multiple teams, applications, and services. We are looking for engineers who have a strong self-directed work ethic, a nimble mindset, and a strong personal ownership of system quality.
As a DevOps engineer, you will focus on highly available web services and infrastructure. You will be tasked with adding features focused on reliability, self-healing, and observability while also providing tools and automation to package, deploy, monitor, and diagnose systems in production with fully-functional CI/CD pipelines. The tooling and automation will span from AWS hosted services, to on-prem deployable components.
The ideal candidate is open and passionate about the latest approaches to developing cloud services, has the ability to determine the relevancy of technology/language decisions for different problems, and is passionate about solving problems across the full stack. The candidate focuses on simplicity, quality, consistency and leverages data-driven decision making while maintaining a healthy sense of urgency on delivery. This role will significantly impact the architecture and development practices of the entire organization.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines taking code from source control all the way to production, leveraging technologies involving containerization, AWS, Jenkins/Bamboo, and vSphere
Design and implement solutions and practices to improve the "observability" and auto-remediation/self-healing of our software in production including monitoring, auto-scaling, logging and the related toolsets/services/canary tests to ensure SLA's are met and maintained
Design and implement automated deployment tests to safely deploy code-changes to production with minimal downtime
Drive KPI's and data as a core theme to determine system constraints and inform design decisions
Participate in agile "sprints" with the rest of the engineering team
Work closely with internal security groups to ensure application, infrastructure, and procedural security requirements are met
Requirements
Experience working with AWS technologies including deployment and monitoring
Experience with modern scripting language(s) such as bash, python, ruby or an equivalent
Experience with Java and/or C#
Knowledge of networking concepts, infrastructure templating, source control, and working with containers
Great communication skills
This position is eligible for the JoinEUC referral campaign.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We’re the company behind the world’s fastest satellite internet service, with technology that’s helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.
Job Responsibilities
Viasat designs, builds, and operates high-capacity satellite networks - bringing broadband Internet access to the world. ATG is Viasat's data division. Every day, petabytes of data from Viasat networks across the globe are collected, processed, and stored - and our Data Platform team makes it all happen. By leveraging modern tools such as Spark, Kafka, and Impala, we equip every employee with the power to make data driven decisions.
Our Team
The Viasat analytics group uses latest big-data technologies (Spark, Kafka, Impala, Hadoop) to analyze petabytes of data streaming from our operational systems. The instrumentation team has touchpoints all across our network and facilitates the efficient data collection, transport, and analysis. Our diverse team of developers, data engineers and data scientists creates innovative solutions to gain technical and business insights.
Your Opportunity
Digital marketing analyst will drive digital strategy and analyze the effects of marketing efforts.
Use Snowplow Analytics to collect, enhance, and analyze data
Use font end analytics tools like Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics to learn from user behavior
Design and run AB tests across multiple web properties and platforms
Our Ideal Candidate
We value curiosity, learning, and adaptability. Our ideal candidate loves solving tough problems using data.
In this position, you will:
Design, build and own data collection, pipelines, and tests
Communicate with management and influence business strategy
Use Jupyter notebooks to analyze data and tests
At a minimum, we are looking for people who are:
Comfortable with programming languages including Python and/or Javascript
Comfortable with Linux environment and common tools
Travel up to 10%
You'll be especially competitive if you have any of:
Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Impala or other big data technologies experience
Experience with Snowplow, Google Analytics, or other analytics framework is a big plus
Built and ran AB tests, segmented marketing campaigns, digital marketing experience
Startup experience
Analytics spanning the full customer journey including e-commerce

title: Sr. Cloud/Systems Engineer
description:
Description
We are looking for humble, but passionate and self-motivated engineers to join our team. We welcome those who see things differently, aren't afraid to experiment, practice the fail fast philosophy, and are comfortable having healthy debates with your peers.
As Sr. Cloud/Systems Engineer you will be one of the leaders of a highly technical team managing the customer facing, worldwide infrastructure for L Brands sites such as VictoriasSecret.com, PinkNation.com, LB.com, and more. You will live, eat, and breathe the principals of availability, performance, reliability, and automation. You will maintain a close partnership with development teams; helping them architect and implement their applications and environments via new and innovative methods that break the traditional infrastructure model.
You Are:
A Guru of production *nix based systems! You have 5+ years of running critical Unix/Linux systems either on premise or in the cloud of your choice.
A performance master! You are never satisfied with the performance you are seeing and always know you can get a little bit more if you pull this lever.
Willing to automate yourself out of a job! You cringe at the thought of manually updating any systems. You have automated and scaled datacenters via readily available tools such as Chef (bonus points), Ansible, Terraform, and the like. You are comfortable with various scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Golang, Ruby, Bash
A Dev-ops Junkie! You know that the combination of Development and Operations is akin to being part of a super-hero task force. You are familiar with agile methodologies, the periodic table of devops tooling, and strive for perfection in the applications you deliver as a team.
Customer Focused! You understand that when she is shopping, the last thing she wants to see is a "server down" message, or wait for 60 seconds for her order to process. You take pride in and have a sense of ownership for everything you release into the wild.
Qualifications
You Will:
Be a full stack engineer! Meaning you will design, implement, and own creative solutions in support of our network, middleware, operating systems, applications, traffic management, security, and associated hardware.
Always remain curious! Meaning you will continuously evaluate and POC new technologies, while always questioning the industry standards or status quo.
Be a Leader! As a Senior member of the team, you will regularly mentor and cross-train the Junior members of the team. You actively engage with peers to provide recommendations, opinions, and sometimes just to check in!
Put on your detective hat! Meaning you will have a starring role in the troubleshooting of our environment. You help to debug, diagnose, and resolve critical issues in the environments. You help implement tools to cover our blind spots and make sure we never experience the same issue twice!
Be the first line of defense! Meaning Operations! You are a leader within the team that operates and maintains critical systems. We all own the performance, reliability, and availability of them and we take pride in it.
An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual's race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. We only hire individuals authorized for employment in the United States.

We are a venture-backed company that combines artificial intelligence and intelligent robotics to change the way companies do business. Our company includes a team of world class technology experts recruited from centers of excellence including iRobot, Amazon, Uber, Tesla, Kiva Systems, Google, Microsoft, Carnegie Mellon, MIT, Cornell, University of Pennsylvania, Rethink Robotics, Lockheed Martin, BAE, Honeywell, and others. Prior work by this team resulted in more than 30 commercial products and billions of dollars in product revenue. Simply put, our team knows how to produce disruptive products that generate value for our customers.
As a company, we work hard and are creating material impact with our customers. Some would feel the need to say, “we work hard and play hard.” At Berkshire Grey our work is so rewarding that most of us finish a day and think “what could be more amazing?” Our culture is highly collaborative and open, the technical problems are challenging, the business opportunities are magnificent, and the value of your work to the customers and to the world is clear. Indeed, what could be better?

title: Full Stack Engineer, Creative Cloud Learning
description:

Plans, designs, develops and tests software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products including cloud-based or internet-related tools.
The Challenge
The Creative Cloud Learn team partners with Creative Cloud applications to provide application users with the appropriate help and support in their learning journey of our feature-rich applications. From assessing users’ experience level, through offering the most relevant tutorials or guiding the user in performing specific tasks based on user intent, we use a variety of technologies to help increase customer success. Our team builds services, applications and tools, as well as Machine Learning solutions to accomplish these results. Come join us and work on the Creative Cloud Learn Engineering team to build web applications, services and tools to support our Creative Cloud Products Learning workflow.
