title: Drilling Installation Engineer
description:
Position Overview
This position is a solid independent contributor able to complete more complex work without direct supervision. A SDS Installation Engineer is a critical component to ensuring proper planning and execution of post manufacturing services to our customers. An Installation Engineer’s responsibilities include, but are not limited to: field installation support, technical documentation, product design review and validation, technical planning, customer interface, project execution, product and system troubleshooting, performance testing, product maintenance, repair and refurbishment.
Responsibilities may include:
Understand implication of variations in customer, code or contract compliance. Consult and help others to recognize when to consult with other departmental functions.
Translate customer requirements into product specific specifications. Identify technology/product gaps in specifications.
Performs as a process owner. Actively starts to recommend improvements. Actively works with the supplier and customer requirements.
Able to work independently on the more varied and complex tasks and/or functional leadership without direct supervision as needed.
Responsible for safe, high quality, high quantity and on-time-delivery of assigned project deliverables assigned by project leaders, direct or indirect managers.
Potential for offsite and international travel.
Fully competent in shop/lab assembly or field installation or testing, may begin to lead. Able to identify and troubleshoot system issues.
Attend internal and external meetings and serve as TechnipFMC technical focal point for multiple projects.
Develop solutions to problems by analyzing, interpreting and evaluating data. Anticipates potential problem and identifies and proposes required preventive actions.
Provide leadership for on/offshore personnel including operations coordinators, workshop manager and quality department on technical requests.
Provide technical support and leadership for onshore/offshore activities for more complex systems.
Periodically assigned as “on-call engineer” to support technical issues that may arise in the workshop or offshore.
Research and provide technical disposition relating to field non-conformances for service notifications and service alerts. Approves conclusion /resolutions for service notifications and service alerts.
Review/Approve rig books and all associated installation documents.
Provide interface resolution between TechnipFMC and non-TechnipFMC equipment. Ensure regional alignment with other projects.
Hosting and/or attending readiness reviews for on or off-site execution of work (ORR) for assigned projects.
Hosting and/or attending after action reviews for on or off-site execution of work (AAR) for assigned projects.
Responsible to ensure functional locations are created for multiple projects.
Identify the need for specialty equipment needed to support customer operations related to services engineering. Support development of such products.
Provide engineering support for all new quotes and CTRs/support services quotes group.
Ensure cooperation and interaction across diverse stakeholders, both internal and external to the organization, often managing familiar and less challenging customers.
Frequent contact and interface with operation managers, product group engineering departments, onshore assembly and maintenance technicians, technical service professionals, vendors , contractors and regional engineering teams.
Frequent interface with internal and external project stakeholders identifying/clarifying technical scope and problem solving.
Strong contacts and relations with multiple key customer contacts.
Provide guidance and motivation to project team members and build effective relationships with peers, co-workers, customers, and industry representatives.
Position Qualifications
Basic/required:
Legally authorized to work in the job posting country
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering required
Generally 5+ years of relevant experience, preferably in field or shop environment
Previous experience in Subsea Drilling Systems preferred
Foundational awareness of relevant industry standards related to SDS (API 5DP, TH Hill DS-1, etc.)
Full understanding of theory specific to area of specialty and/or single/multiple product, including code and criteria requirements
Recognize the impact of variances to scope, cost and schedule
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English are important
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment is important
Ability to give and receive constructive feedback and coaching, and respond appropriately
Ability to work in a remote environment with no supervision
Work Environment
Spend 70 - 80% of time in an office environment and 20 -30% in shop or field environment supporting product installation, refurbishment, repair, stack-up, buck-up and/or assembly.
Physical Demands
Office environment requires sitting, operating a computer, walking and some lifting. Hands-on labor in shop and/or field environment, which requires lifting, walking, stooping, bending, and some climbing.

title: Digital Application Developer
description:
SUMMARY
The Digital Application Developer will be a key part of a dynamic, cross-departmental, digital banking team and be responsible for delivering online products and services in a timely manner with a focus on continuous user experience improvement. This role reports to the VP of Development but will work closely with the VP of Digital Strategy.
ANTICIPATED WORK SCHEDULE
The ideal candidate must be available to work a full time schedule which may vary dependent on the needs of the TAT and Administration teams.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Collaborates with cross-functional project team members to understand and contribute technical requirements of the digital banking platform and related systems, including preparing technical scope documentation, work effort estimates, and development/deployment task breakdowns.
Works to ensure that digital solutions are built to offer the best Member experience possible, while managing strict operations and regulatory controls around security and data privacy.
Builds and maintains full stack web or mobile applications and microservices hosted by the credit union or through vendor SDK(s).
Builds and maintains integration to relevant third-party systems as needed through Webservice, Single Sign On (SSO) and/or API.
Manages and adheres to stringent control standards and error avoidance methodologies including proper use of development staging environments, Unit, QA, and UAT test controls, code reviews, and technical documentation compilation.
Collaborates with technical teams to build application enhancements, ensuring seamless integration with back-end core programming, infrastructure, and related systems.
Assists in managing the health of internet and mobile platforms, by working closely with internal teams and 3rd party vendors to troubleshoot and remediate system and code relates issues.
Ensures quality of all work, including testing functionality with various account and member scenarios, different browsers, mobile devices, and varying UI resolutions.
Works closely with the Digital Strategy & Member Experience teams to make decisions regarding the overall development of the credit union’s internet and mobile banking technologies.
Demonstrates technical aptitude by staying current with evolving digital technology and fintech trends through independent research, vendor conferences, and collaboration with other developers.
Performs all other duties as assigned.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS
These specifications are general guidelines based on the minimum experience normally considered essential to the satisfactory performance of this job. Individual abilities may result in some deviation from these guidelines.
To perform effectively in this position, the incumbent must have:
Bachelor’s degree in computer programming, web development or equivalent education and experience.
3+years of experience in professional digital application development, including experience with .NET.
Experience working at a credit union or within the financial services industry preferred.
Experience with overseeing unit testing and overall improvement of product performance.
Ability to meet deadlines and conduct research.
Effective verbal and written communications skills.
Excellent problem solving, analytical and evaluative skills.
Applied knowledge of .NET, C#, HTML5, or other modern web frameworks
Applied knowledge of Web services development: JSON, SOAP, Servlets, Widgets, CSS, XML
Preferred knowledge of online/mobile banking, iOS, and Android platforms.
Applied knowledge of change management procedures and the Software Development Life Cycle including Agile (SCRUM) and Waterfall development methodologies.
Preferred knowledge of JIRA, Confluence development tools/workflow integration
Practical, working knowledge of Microsoft SQL, personal computing systems, Microsoft Office, and network operating systems.
Current and valid CA driver’s license AND satisfactory current driving record with DMV.
Automobile insurance that includes minimum liability coverage as required by state law.
Typically, these skills are the result of a combination of formal education and/or several years of work experience. The incumbent must be able to perform this job safely, without endangering the health or safety of self or others.
CU SoCal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

-

As we expand the commercialization of the CardioCare software application, we are continuing to build-out a full-time development team by complementing our engineering leader with an architect level front-end oriented full-stack engineer. As a senior member of this entrepreneurial group, this individual will be responsible for helping define and achieve our organization’s technology roadmap by designing, developing, and implementing new products and delivering an exceptional user experience. #LI-LP1

Edwards Lifesciences is the global leader in patient-focused medical innovations for structural heart disease, as well as critical care and surgical monitoring. Driven by a passion to help patients, the company collaborates with the world's leading clinicians and researchers to address unmet healthcare needs, working to improve patient outcomes and enhance lives. Headquartered in Irvine, California, Edwards Lifesciences has extensive operations in North America, Europe, Japan, Latin America and Asia and currently employs over 10,000 individuals worldwide.
For us, helping patients is not a slogan - it's our life's work. From developing devices that replace or repair a diseased heart valve to creating new technologies that monitor vital signs in the critical care setting, we focus on helping patients regain and improve the quality of their life. Edwards is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

title: Senior AEM Developer (UI)
description:
At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. We have built a foundation of high-trust by treating all people with dignity, making and keeping commitments, and consistently striving to do the right thing. Our leaders optimistically share future possibilities to inspire and motivate others toward their full potential. We expect our employees to find ways to embrace positive change, be curious and challenge the status quo, and provide solutions to unmet problems. Joining Delta Dental means joining a culture focused on fostering development, building genuine connections, recognizing each other’s strengths and sharing in successes.
We are looking for a highly effective senior developer to join our Application Development team. As a key member of the team, you will contribute to the overall technical strategy, implementation and delivery of tools and applications for the Sales, Marketing and Communication teams. You will contribute to the entire software development lifecycle including analysis, requirement specification, use cases, technical design, development and testing.
How you will make an impact:
Apply your understanding of web standards, web technologies, WCM and Adobe AEM to the design and implementation of new projects and site re-designs.
Build and support exceptional customer-facing products that provide innovative solutions to challenging business use cases.
Design, develop and maintain responsive web applications providing peerless user experiences on desktop and mobile devices.
Write high quality code with attention to scalability, security and performance.
Adhere to standard marketing practices surrounding brand compliance and web accessibility.
Collaborate closely with marketing leadership, product managers and creative team members to define, prioritize and scope business and functional requirements to drive results.
Accurately scope technical effort, identifying risks, options and trade-offs.
Work within the technical team to deliver high quality products and features.
Participate in the ongoing monitoring and production health of deployed applications and services.
What we look for:
10-12 years of experience designing and developing secure consumer-facing web applications.
7-10 years of content management experience with recent Adobe AEM experience
Minimum of 7 years Java and J2EE/JEE software development experience.
Experience in web technologies including: CSS, HTML, XML and AJAX / Javascript.
Experience with one or more Java concepts and patterns including: JSP, Spring, Sling, JMS, Junit, AOP, MVC and Eclipse.
Experience developing web services and application integrations.
Experience with source code control systems: CVS, SVN and Git.
Experience with developing and deploying applications on AWS or private cloud.
Experience with full stack software development.
Experience with Scrum, Agile Methodology.
Strong problem solving and communication skills.
BS in computer science or equivalent technical field or equivalent work experience.
Benefits and perks:
12 days starting vacation plus 11 holidays and your birthday off!
Multiple medical insurance options: 100% paid or low cost premiums
100% paid dental insurance
100% paid vision insurance
Onsite gym and/or gym discount and fitness incentive
Culture of learning: substantial tuition reimbursement to improve your skills
Career growth: we love promoting from within
Strong commitment to work/life balance
Technology allowance
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities
At Delta Dental we:
Promote accountability, integrity and collaboration:
Our employees are collaborative, self-aware, and ethical. It is our expectation to do the right thing and follow through on commitments.
Foster professional development:
Our employees take ownership of developing self and others through coaching, mentoring and providing/being open to constructive feedback and identifying learning opportunities.
Value customers and cultivate positive experiences:
Our employees take time to build rapport with customers, while anticipating and exceeding their needs to ensure positive outcomes.
If you think this sounds like you, let’s chat. We would love to tell you more!
Follow us
@lifeatDDins on Instagram
,
lifeatDDins on Facebook
,
@lifeatDDins on Twitter
ABOUT Delta Dental
Delta Dental covers more Americans than any other dental benefits provider. As an employee you’ll take part in our mission to become the trusted health partner by collaborating with our communities and employees to reimagine and deliver new possibilities in an ever-changing environment. Our Enterprise Strategy focuses on pillars of Growth and Diversification, supported by the platforms of Culture and People, Process and Technology. Our employees take pride working for a purpose-driven organization and live our values of Trust, Service, Excellence and Innovation.
We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation’s largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.
Delta Dental provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. title: Sr. Big Data Architect
description:
Position Description:
CGI, founded in 1976 on the concept of creating an organization focused on delivering results and exceeding client expectations. Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. At CGI-Burlington, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership.
Seasoned data professional with experience in Big Data with Machine learning / Artificial Intelligence implementations as a plus. Will lead data strategies and implementations within Emerging Technology to grow current and future staff members and create BU capabilities within Big Data and Advanced Analytics. Member will work with ETP sector lead to create and execute business plan. Member will help to hire and develop staff. This position will work with sector vice presidents to integrate data capabilities within their teams and clients. This resource must be able to create sales material, proposals and present them to clients, including executive level clients. This resource will help present at most VIP meetings with clients.

title: Full Stack Developer – IBM Data & AI
description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. To lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems.
Your Role and Responsibilities
Software Developers in IBM Hybrid Cloud design, build and deploy complex and highly reliable applications and services to provide optimum integration into Enterprise IT systems, with capabilities to create a dedicated instance for each customer.
As a Full Stack Developer, you will use your enterprise-level programming skills to engineer scalable technologies.
In this role you will:
Design and implement components
Implement the services business logic programming algorithms and software design concepts
Integrate and configure the services into the architecture
Qualifications
You apply creativity and judgment to your developmental work on different projects and jump at the chance to share your findings to make those around you better at what they do. You recognize complex problems related to functional objectives quickly, analyze situations and implement solutions to fix them.
We believe you are a good fit for this role if you:
Are passionate about and possess experience crafting technology solutions and eliminating mundane and repetitive work
Are a systematic problem solver at heart, agile and adaptable in changing priorities
Have never encountered a deadline you couldn’t meet
Possess strong client-facing skills, and are capable of diffusing issues with ease
Are well-versed in general software architecture and design concepts, and have experience applying them in the development of enterprise level software products
Who You’ll Work With
You’ll have the opportunity to work with a dynamic and independent team of engineers and other functions such as Architecture, QA, Product Management and Delivery to design and develop advanced capabilities. We come to work thrilled knowing it will never be the same day twice. This variety enables us to be innovative convergent thinkers who juggle challenging requirements with agility.
Today’s operating environment demands a stack that’s responsive to the innovative enterprise – one that can demonstrate all data types & access the latest technologies. By 2020, businesses will contribute at least 50% of IT spend on cloud. Be part of a diverse and global team of thinkers and doers - people who want to make an impact, nurture their expertise and collaborate with some of the world’s top business and technology professionals.
IBM Cloud Private for Data can accelerate your journey to Big Data and AI by simplifying hybrid data management, data governance, and business analytics with a single interface. Be an integral part of this team that makes data simple and available across the enterprise to help drive a data driven culture. We’re hiring...
JOIN US.

#swdev #java #PaaS #redux @IBMCloud #SDLC #Linux #UNIX #nodejs #webservice #javascript #python #opensource @caffeinate_adam #IDE #Flask #SCRUM #IBMToday #openshift #CICD #SaaS @IBMNAJobs #jenkins #API #terraform

Real passion for data science and data analytics
5+ years' software programming experience (or 1+ years with Master's degree) in
ANY
OF the following languages like Python, NodeJS, Java, C++
Knowledge in working on Linux
Familiarity with git, various development IDEs, Jenkins
Experience with Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) methodologies, Agile SDLC
Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
6+ years software programming experience in all the following languages like Python, NodeJS, Java, C++
2+ years' experience building containerized services and with Kubernetes based deployments.
Expertise in working on Linux
Knowledge and/or experience in Red Hat OpenShift
Well versed in working with one or more Cloud IaaS or PaaS APIs, automation & orchestration technologies such as Ansible, or Terraform
Master’s degree in computer science or related field
About Business Unit
Digitization is accelerating the ongoing evolution of business, and clouds - public, private, and hybrid - enable companies to extend their existing infrastructure and integrate across systems. IBM Cloud provides the security, control, and visibility that our clients have come to expect. We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our client’s data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.
Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?
Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world. What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.
Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.
About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

title: Front End Engineer - Equities Electronic Trading
description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
What We Do
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action.
At Goldman Sachs, our culture is one of teamwork, innovation and meritocracy. We often say our people are our greatest asset and we take pride in supporting each colleague both professionally and personally. From collaborative work spaces and mindfulness classes to working from home and flexible work options, we offer our people the support they need to reach their goals in and outside the office.
Goldman Sachs Electronic Trading (GSET) has launched an initiative to become the top provider in electronic trading by building superior technology and delivering high quality products. This vision is a multi-year investment in people, platforms and products. Join the team, and participate in the development and launch of best in class products for top clients across the industry. We are looking for eager, nimble and ambitious engineers to join our growing team of visionaries, and drive Goldman Sachs Electronic Trading to achieve and exceed our goals.
Your Impact
This team is accountable for platform architecture evolution to meet the evolving needs of different business lines globally with rapid software deployment. As stewards of critical components in order execution and post-trade, the team is accountable for a high degree of software quality. The team consists of self-guided pragmatic individuals who are motivated to change the status quo in calculated ways.
As a member of the team, you will play an integral role on the trading floor. This is a dynamic, entrepreneurial team with a passion for technology and the markets, with individuals who thrive in a fast-paced changing environment. The team takes a data driven approach to decision making and you should be willing to participate in the full product lifecycle from requirements gathering, design, implementation, testing, support, and monitoring trading performance for systems and strategies used by our clients.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
Responsibilities
Strong UI development skills with good UX experience
Driven individual with strong analytical, design and architecture skills
Ability to efficiently work within a global team
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Good team player and good interpersonal skills
Self-starter and able to work in a high paced environment
Must be willing to handle first line support calls and work on a support rota
Maintain a focus on quality, attention to detail, communication and delivery to tight timescales
Basic Qualifications
Full Stack Developer with 3+ years of experience in developing web applications using HTML5/React.JS/AngularJS/Angular on Typescript
Good knowledge of core Java and middle tier systems
Real time streaming using Websockets, and Restful services
Web development frameworks with NodeJS, Gulp etc
Frameworks and components like Bootstrap, ag-Grid etc
Familiarity with testing frameworks (Karma, Jasmine, PhantomJS, Selenium, Cucumber) and concepts of Test Driven Development, Regression and Parametric Testing
Strong skills in Web services, Spring, Vert-x to support Rest and Websockets
Strong OO design skills and experience
Design Patterns knowledge
Preferred Qualifications
View servers, such as AMPS
Linux / Unix skills including scripting (shell)
Working experience with databases
Experience in developing distributed real-time systems
Knowledge of financial markets would be an advantage
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.
© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

title: Software Engineer, Android Application Architecture and Development, Hardware, Nest
description:
In school or graduated within last 9 months? We encourage you to apply to openings on the Student Jobs site
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience coding in Java or C++.
Experience working with Internet of Things (IoT) hardware as well as software technologies.
Experience with mobile application architecture and development.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience in computer science.
Knowledge of UI frameworks, MVP application design, and complex, reactive touch based UI.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design optimized for embedded systems.
Experience building front-end services for mobile applications.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
In this role, you will solve complex and interesting challenges. You will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native or mobile application development, pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms.
As a Software Engineers in Android Applications, you will work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. You will build Nest/Home products for Android systems. In this role, you will develop the framework and architecture for applications and feature teams primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. Additionally, you will design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project, or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.
Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
Responsibilities
Work with mobile and services engineers to define the app architecture.
Design and implement full stack app foundation features and core app features for the Nest/Home Android app.
Work with peers in app feature teams to identify opportunities for app foundation features which will help increase the productivity of the entire team and increase the velocity of app feature work.
Advocate app architecture and guide app feature teams towards best utilization of app foundation features.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Full Stack Engineer - Java / Angular / Node
description:
Why American Express?
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.
American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.
We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and momentum into the best future they envision.
Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.
The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.
American Express is in the midst of an exciting product and technology transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative customer data driven products at a rapid pace, serving our consumers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team! A seasoned Senior Software Engineer with a passion to build data intensive systems is wanted to partner with the Customer 360 Platform team in a bid to change the technology landscape.

A hands-on Software Engineer with high energy and eager to grow technically.
Understanding of Enterprise Integration Patterns and Reactive Patterns.Understanding and familiarity of popular web application JavaScript frameworks (Angular.js, React.js).
Strong communication skills
A strategic thinker, capable to clearly illustrate and sell ideas while managing risk.
Expertise in the definition and implementation of effective software engineering practices and processes that result in high speed to market: i.e. open source style project maintainers, PR review process, issue triage, code reviews, code contribution metrics definition, test automation strategy, CI/CD optimization, etc.
Responsible for developing proof of concepts, curate tech frameworks and ship software components that will be used as the backbone for the platform and used by tenths of developers.
Job Responsibilities:
The Customer 360 Platform team is responsible for providing a holistic view of the customer to the enterprise systems within the company. Our challenge is to modernize our legacy systems, while providing continuous service excellence to our customers. In this role, you will partner with our talented team to design and build cloud native applications and enhance our portal to provide a more intuitive and seamless user experience. Also, we are embarking on an exciting journey into adopting inner source culture that will transform the way AMEX builds software.
Qualifications
This high energy Engineer is expected to have:
3+ years of software engineering experience.
Java 8+ programming is a must. Polyglot experience (Go, node.js) is a super plus.
Demonstrated experience with front-end design and JavaScript frameworks, specifically Angular.js and React.js.
Understanding with SQL and NOSQL databases (Couchbase, Elastic Search databases preferred).
Substantial experience in an agile enterprise setting.
Demonstrated experience with continuous integration tooling such as Jenkins pipelines.
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or Red Hat Openshift is a plus.
Experience with Atlassian software development and collaboration tools (Bitbucket JIRA, Confluence, etc.).
Experience with microservice frameworks: Spring Boot, Dropwizard, Vert.x
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
The Platform Engineer is responsible for ensuring that our store environment is consistent and secure. This position will be responsible for plan ning , deploy ing and troubleshoot ing application stacks in support of our established retail operating environments and will engineer new environments for future-state objectives. This position will work autonomously and with minimal direction.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Owns the hardware spec for the point-of-sale environment and optimize platform builds and automation.
Develops and maintains the operating system build for the point-of-sale environment.
Automating, Builds, Tests, and Version control for point-of-sale software; speeding up the deployment process and delivering consistency.
Ensure System/service performance tuning, troubleshooting and debugging.
Implement monitoring technologies for determining store health, versions, and reporting.
Develop system configuration management templates and audit systems against those templates over the system lifecycle.
Assists when needed cross-functionally with deployment and e-commerce support teams.
Work with developers to quickly identify and address issues to provide smooth code rollouts and seamless change back-out when there are problems.
Works with level 1 & 2 helpdesks to ensure the environment is consistent and can be supported.
Develops consistent documentation for engineering and knowledgebase articles for support teams.
Act as a resource for less experienced colleagues.
SUPPLEMENTAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Works with QA to assist in creating test environments.
Assists with troubleshooting store configurations and middleware connecting stores.
Install configure and maintain “cloud” hosting technologies.
Working with virtualization, container technologies, and routine task automation.
MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar area. Experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Minimum of four (4) years of Windows systems administration experience.
Experience with OS builds standardization, systems hardening, and virtualization.
Experience with modern configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef, Intune, SCCM.
Working knowledge and experience with Networking fundamentals.
Expert skill level in Scripting and Automation.
Willingness to document technical processes and share knowledge with others. Capable of following and composing process and procedure documentation, as well as training other users on complex topics.
Ability to interact with colleagues from all levels of the organization, both technical and non-technical, and communicate technical ideas effectively.
Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as in a team environment.
Someone driven to get an “extra 9” of availability.
PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
QSR experience.
Linux systems administration experience is a plus.
Ability to learn new technologies or support existing applications quickly and with minimal guidance.
Thrives on technical challenges and takes pride in solving them.
Comfortable in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, and doing things differently.
WORK CONDITIONS:
This is a full-time position that provides engineering level support, on a 24 x 7 schedule, for all operational and outage issues relating to the infrastructure.
Ability to participate in an on-call rotation performing weekend and after-hours support.
Works in a normal office environment where there is no physical discomfort due to temperature, noise, dust and the like.

title: Full Stack Developer with a specialty in Blockchain - Summer Intern
description:
Since our founding in 1919, The New School (TNS) has redrawn and redefined the boundaries of intellectual and creative thought as a preeminent academic center. Our rigorous, multidimensional approach to education dissolves walls between disciplines and helps nurture progressive minds. At our university, students have the academic freedom to shape their unique, individual paths for a complex and rapidly changing world. Our colleges include Parsons School of Design, Eugene Lang College of Liberal Arts, the College of Performing Arts, The New School for Social Research, the Schools of Public Engagement, and Parsons Paris. The New School is committed to diversity in the workplace.
The New School Information Technology is looking for a driven and talented senior, graduate or Ph.D. student to join our team as a Full-Stack Developer Blockchain Intern. During the assignment, you are expected to deliver a prototype application.
This is a paid internship anticipated to begin in late May and run through August, 2019.
Over the course of this summer internship, you’ll work alongside members of the IT department to build projects to enhance The New School experience. By leveraging data that spans our digital and physical environments, you’ll produce a product that will aid in helping us create a more intelligent and connected campus, improving enrollment services and student, faculty, and staff life.
You will take full ownership and responsibility of the project you produce, from designing the right solution to implementing and presenting it. You will work with a cross-functional team of data scientists, designers, and developers as well as gather input from team members from around the university including student success, enrollment, admission, open campus, marketing, and operations.
Major Responsibilities
Collaborate with students, faculty, and staff to identify innovation opportunities.
Work independently, diligently, and efficiently on assigned tasks and projects.
Collaborate seamlessly with colleagues from other technical and client teams.
Hands-on programming experience using:
Python, Java, Node.js, C/C++, JavaScript, or PHP
MVC Framework
HTML 5
CSS
SQL and MySQL
ReactJS
MongoDB
Development experience with Hyperledger and Ethereum
Enthusiasm for innovation in the tech industry, including continuous learning and improvement
Minimum Qualifications:
Applicants must be at least a rising junior and above and must have a track record of student success and potential as demonstrated by a minimum 3.2 GPA, projects portfolio, prior work experiences and/or the recommendation of a professor preferred. Students pursuing a Master’s degree or Ph.D. are strongly encouraged to apply.
Preferred Qualifications:

title: Full Stack Software Engineer (React/Java)
description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or 4+ years relevant work experience
4+ years working with HTML, CSS, JavaScript
2+ years of web application code design and architecture
Proficient in 1 or more core languages (e.g. Java, C++, Python, Ruby, and Node.js)
Proficient in 1 or more version control software platforms (e.g. git, Subversion, Mercurial)
Are you passionate about the intersection of cloud computing, mobile applications, BigData analytics, and digital user engagement?
We are looking for front-end engineers who long for the opportunity to design and build large-scale applications with global impact. You will get a unique opportunity to build full-stack applications in the mobile and web spaces at AWS scale. Our service is built on different AWS services including Cognito, Lambda, API Gateway, S3, Kinesis, EMR, Redshift, Dynamo, SNS, Athena, and QuickSight.
You will build web applications that leverage big data technology and machine learning to improve user engagement with mobile apps and web applications. The messaging and targeting applications you build will power the world’s leading social media, gaming, sports, educational, and consumer applications. You will work closely with Product Management to best address our customers' needs and help shape the product for success by creating engaging and dynamic experiences.
What does it take to succeed in this role?
You need to be creative, responsible, and able to dive deep into emerging web, mobile, and AWS technologies. You will think about business opportunities, operational issues, architectural diagrams, and the customer perspective in the course of a single conversation. You have a deep mastery of programming languages, front-end application development, and performance engineering. Someone who makes the team both productive and fun to work in. Excited to learn from others while bringing your own novel capabilities and perspectives. Our team members thrive in a hands-on environment where everyone actively participates in product definition, technical architecture review, iterative development, code review, and operations.
Our customers are innovators, and you will have the chance to work with them to understand their challenges and design new offerings. Together, we’ll shape not just our own products, but the direction of the industry.
About Pinpoint
Amazon Pinpoint makes it easy to run targeted campaigns to improve user engagement. Pinpoint helps you understand your users’ behavior, define who to target, what messages to send, when to deliver them, and tracks the results of the campaign. Pinpoint enables real-time analytics with dashboards for analyzing user engagement, monetization, user demographics, custom events, and funnels so you can understand how users engage with your application. You can analyze and understand your user data by drilling down based on the segments you’ve defined, segmentation attributes, or time.
Learn more about our business at https://aws.amazon.com/pinpoint/.
Delivered one or more production web applications (500+ users) using a contemporary JavaScript framework (e.g. Angular, React, Backbone, Ember, Meteor, jQuery)
Experience using a JavaScript build tool (e.g. Grunt, Gulp)
Passion for creating efficient, scalable, highly usable web interfaces
Excited about technology, have a strong interest in learning about and playing with the latest technologies and building compelling web applications and UI
Work well in teams, respecting and welcoming ideas from partners, business stakeholders, and technical experts
Strong customer focus, ownership, urgency and drive
Design expertise and experience with UI and workflow prototyping tools
Strong web development experience for 3rd party developer use or console work
Ability to convert a design document into a working user interface with no loss in fidelity
Knowledge of usability principles, cross-browser compatibility, and HTML document architecture

description:

title: Full Stack Developer Intern
description:

Dominieren Corporation is a small but growing company, and we are on the lookout for top talent to bring on board now, during our early phases, and help build an exciting company from the ground up!

At this time, employees and interns of Dominieren Corporation will spend significant time working for some of the enterprises we are in the process of launching, and will have a "start-up" feel as we build everything from marketing strategy to technological platforms from the ground up.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Backend (Auto) - Culver City, CA
description:
Credit Karma is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our fast-growing Autos vertical in Los Angeles. Our engineering team is responsible for empowering our members to make the best financial decisions when it comes to their cars. This includes creating innovative new features leveraging Credit Karma's core strengths of data, scale, and high engagement to help members buy new cars, get the best insurance, and better manage their existing cars.
We are a growing engineering team, yet we offer a great deal of autonomy and flexibility. If you're a person who enjoys working with a lot of freedom, but knows how to take full ownership of a project and execute with quality, then this is the role for you.
What the Job Entails
Contribute to our core services and data aggregation layer; meeting our need for scale, quality, and rapid iteration.
Build out high quality integrations with other internal services leveraging Credit Karma’s rich financial data set.
Work closely with our external partners to acquire new data to enrich our core user experience.
Develop automation throughout our stack; through our build & deployment processes, testing, monitoring, data pipeline, and beyond.
Work with front-end developers to complete end-to-end solutions and iterate rapidly as we experiment and learn.
Willingness to learn new skills as our product and technology footprint grows.
Our Ideal Candidate
Proficient in at least one dynamic server-side language: Java, Scala, Python, C#, PHP, Ruby or similar!
A solid foundation in OOP, design patterns, algorithms, programming languages, networking and Linux operating systems.
Expert understanding of web application internals and scalability at any tier.
Strong understanding of deployment strategies and production infrastructure needs.
Experience in API design and building robust and extendable client/server contracts.
Proficiency in SQL, relational database schema design and ORM technologies & concepts.
Strong communication and leadership abilities.
Experience with Agile/Scrum practices.
An interest in mentoring and coaching is a plus!
Credit Karma is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. We believe that such an environment advances long-term professional growth, creates a robust business, and supports our mission of championing financial progress for everyone. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye single to fostering an inclusive environment that recognizes the contributions of all. We’ve worked hard to build an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and the opportunity for professional growth. As part of the Credit Karma team, your voice will be heard, your contributions will matter, and your unique background and experiences will be celebrated.
Credit Karma is also proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome all candidates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, genetic information, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic. We prohibit discrimination of any kind and will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.
Our people are everything, our core values are real, and our guiding mission is strong. Join us!

description:

Burns & McDonnell is making the world a more amazing place with more than 5,000 engineers, architects, construction professionals, scientists and consultants on staff and growing. We strive to create amazing success for our clients and amazing careers for our employee-owners. We take on some of the world’s toughest challenges with the industry’s best thinking.

title: React Native Developer
description:
Anexinet specializes in digital business transformation. We empower our clients to grow their customer base and improve workforce efficiency by envisioning, developing, and operating next generation technology solutions. Our core expertise is in digital applications, analytics, and hybrid IT, enabling businesses to rapidly transform. Our clients partner with Anexinet to support the full lifecycle of your next generation digital business. Our people come and stay at Anexinet because we are a technology focused, team-oriented organization with a culture that is second to none as evidenced by our 8 straight Best Place to Work Awards from the Philadelphia Business Journal.
We are recruiting to add a talented mid-to-senior level Full Stack Engineers (full stack developers with React Native and Node.JS experience) for a client project based in the Philadelphia suburbs. During your first few weeks, you will learn the ropes by attending our client’s daily stand-up meetings, collaborating with a mentor, and fixing some minor bugs.
You will learn our client’s Agile development methodology, Continuous Integration systems, and everything in between. Our client is working with some of the latest technology the open source community has to offer, so some ramp-up time is to be expected.
As you grow into this role, you will make meaningful contributions to the client’s codebase, especially their new mobile platform. You will become familiar with all layers of Moven’s stack as they create new features, squash bugs, and help maintain a squeaky-clean codebase. You’ll also gain a wider understanding of our client’s business as you interact with our client’s product and sales teams. Once you master this role, you will take ownership of multiple projects and help define the future for our client. You’ll create new software engineering standards, research solutions to the client’s hairiest problems, and write awesome code. You’ll also act as a technical leader by conducting code reviews, mentoring junior engineers, and conquering technical debt.
Key Skills:
To succeed in this role, you’ll need these skills in your toolbox:
A working knowledge of at least one modern JavaScript UI framework (Angular, React, Vue, or similar)
Experience building RESTful APIs using Node.js and relational databases
Exposure to AWS or similar cloud computing platforms
B.S. in Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent work experience
A plus;
Experience conducting code reviews and mentoring junior engineers
An understanding of current software engineering best practices
A huge plus:
Expertise in ES6, the Flux architecture, React Native, or TypeScript
Experience with containerization, especially Docker and Kubernetes
A working knowledge of GraphQL or Kafka

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
The primary purpose of this position is to support Compeer Financial’s Enterprise Financial Management team by understanding and assessing user needs and applying the appropriate technology to improve processes and meet required reporting needs. The individual ensures projects meet business requirements and goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify and resolve systems issues. The Systems Developer works with end-users to gather requirements, plan, develop, test, and support all activities related to the integration of software programs and applications into the organization’s financial operations information systems. The individual is responsible for daily management and operations of finance business applications including enhancements, bug fixes, interfaces and other business requests and is accountable for technical issue resolution including diagnosis of problems, recommendations for workarounds and defect correction. The individual is involved in new development, rather than vendor-based applications. The Systems Developer also provides written documentation on design and process flow, prioritizing and coordinating multiple small to medium projects at the same time, in order to meet expectations of internal clients.
Essential Functions:
Application Development/Integration and Support: Work with the Enterprise Financial Management team to plan, develop, test, implement, and support all activities related to the development and integration of software programs and applications for the team. Ensure projects meet business requirements and goals and fulfills end-user requirements. Identify and resolve system issues. Create standards and processes to develop and facilitate projects and initiatives.
Project Coordination: Coordinate application integration for small to medium size projects. This may involve providing some direction to Enterprise Financial Management team members and outside consultants and/or vendors. Provide guidance to other Systems Developers. Lead and take ownership and responsibility of assigned department projects and process improvement projects.
Testing: Test newly-integrated software programs and applications. Address issues in program logic. Test the interoperability of new applications with existing systems software.
Documentation: Fully document the various specifications for the new or enhanced processes according to Association standards.
Other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications & Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or business or related field; or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 5 years of related work experience, financial systems application integration preferred. Direct experience with integration tools such as Web Services is a plus.
Microsoft certifications in one of the following areas is a plus: Solution Developer, Technology Specialist and Database Developer.
Required knowledge and experience includes: .NET development (including Visual Studio, C# and ASP.NET); HTML, JavaScript, and CSS; Microsoft SQL Server; Microsoft VBA is a plus.
Knowledge of integration best practices strongly preferred.
Project management skills required.
Analytical skills, accuracy, attention to detail, ability to meet deadlines, and organizational skills.
Strong verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills.
Quick learner who thrives in a collaborative team environment.
On July 1, 2017 AgStar Financial Services, Badgerland Financial and 1st Farm Credit Services joined together as Compeer Financial, strengthening our commitment to the agricultural community.
Compeer Financial, headquartered in Sun Prairie, WI, exists to champion the hopes and dreams of rural America like never before. If you are interested in empowering those in agriculture and rural communities to achieve their goals and expand their possibilities, we invite you to learn more about our organization. We are looking for innovative, dynamic and collaborative team members to join our team.
We offer great benefits including:
Competitive base salary
Health insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.)
401k (3% Compeer contribution & up to an additional 6% match)
Paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays
Educational assistance
Training and development programs
Qualified candidates please apply online at www.compeer.com/careers.
Compeer Financial is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Java Full Stack Developer
description:
Accenture Flex
offers you the flexibility of fixed duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE’s 100 Best Companies to Work For and DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity lists.

employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. Your Role
As a Full Stack Software Engineer you will be building and improving the reliability and performance of modern web applications deployed on scalable cloud infrastructure. The role requires experience with front-end development (PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript), core platform and integration development (Java Spring, J2EE, JEE, REST, SOAP, Adobe CMS), and SQL/NoSQL database technologies – experience with building cloud native applications is a plus (AWS, Azure, Google, Cloud Foundry,etc.). The ideal candidate will be able to creatively work on self-initiated software projects, and spend 60-70% of their time in writing software code to enhance digital experiences, improve web reliability and site performance, and the other 30-40% on responding to and learning from advanced production system challenges. This individual will also be expected to provide escalated production response involving full stack investigation and root-cause analysis.
Basi
c Qualifications
:

title: Software Engineer – Full Stack
description:
Costa Mesa, CA
At Lykuid, we’re on a mission to build the best monitoring platform in the world. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—and high availability, providing always-on alerting, visualization, and tracing for our customers’ infrastructure and applications around the globe.
Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. We need you to design and build machine learning-powered products that help our customers learn from their data and make better decisions in real-time.
You will have a fantastic team of data engineers to support you, a collaborative environment to encourage your work, and the best technologies for performing software engineering at high scale in your toolkit.
Join us to build powerful, intelligent data systems.
In a typical week as a Full Stack Engineer, you might:
Design and implement the Lykuid user interface in multiple formats (web, tablet, mobile, shell),
including the evaluation and selection of key technology platforms.
Participate in end-to-end architecture reviews and discussions with the broader team, playing an
influential role in overall product design.
Collaborate with interaction designers and visual designers to create an intuitive user
experience.
Participate in design and code reviews.
Mentor other engineers on your team.
Identify and communicate best practices for web engineering.
Investigate and fix a production issue from a service your team owns.
Requirements
You have expert knowledge of RESTful APIs, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
You have experience in design and developing rich applications with JavaScript/HTML/CSS.
You are aware of but not reliant on Object Oriented JavaScript Frameworks (Angular, Ember,
Bootstrap, etc.)
You have backend programming experience in Python.
You have a B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical field.
You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment and thrive on autonomy.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Champion Solutions Group’s Professional Services division is growing and looking for Full Stack Engineers with experience in IT security, applications engineering, and development.
We are seeking motivated, self-starters able to deliver high tech IT solutions. If you can bring technical expertise, a passion for learning and innovation; we’ll provide the rest. Our proven methodology of delivering the IT industry’s benchmark products with outstanding customer satisfaction and service help ensure your success. Our team utilizes leading-edge technology to configure, develop, deliver and support applications for our clients across many industries. Our clients are some of the world’s leading companies and you will be part of challenging projects to build and support technical solutions for their needs.
Strong logic and problem solving skills are necessary. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are key. Development of UNIX scripts to aid in release activities and application monitoring, System performance monitoring and tuning as well as responding to and resolving application outages are a plus. Experience with Agile/Scrum development methodology as well as Telecommunication Industry knowledge is a plus.
Champion Solutions Group’s headquarters location is located in Boca Raton, FL; however, this position involves heavy travel to customer sites. All candidates must be willing and able to travel to meet our client needs across the US. For this particular role, we anticipate 50%-70% travel. A road-warrior mindset is a must.
Experience and Skills:
Minimum Technical/Professional Expertise:
Hands-on experience within UNIX and Windows operating systems
Full Understanding of TCP/IP protocols and troubleshooting
Strong logic and problem solving skills
Proficient and comfortable presenting technical topics with IT and Executive staff
Proficient in all applications within the Microsoft Office Suite
Preferred Technical/Professional Expertise in addition to the above
Subject Matter Expert in Unix/Linux environment
-Enterprise level application management - Apache, Tomcat, jboss and equivalent
Experience with cloud-based solutions such AWS, Azure and the like
Demonstratable programming experience (Perl, Python, Java, Javascript preferred)
-Application specific knowledge - IBM QRadar, ServiceNow, IBM BigFix, Splunk, SCCM, ElasticStack
Preferred Education: Bachelor's Degree
Benefits
Benefits:
Champion offers a full benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, disability and 401(k) package

title: Web Developer
description:
Location:
Beachwood, OH
Job Type:
Full-time
Department:
Applications
Career Description
Cultivate strategies and client relationships through digital and traditional marketing services. World Synergy is looking for a talented Web Developer to join our integrated services company and grow our marketing team. This candidate will work closely with Account Strategists, Developers, Creative and IT Teams along with other resources as needed.
Career Responsibilities
Assist Junior and Mid-Level Developers with issues
Manage a suite of projects and the team members working on them
Work with Junior and Mid-level Developers to develop and increase their skill levels
Responsible for the development lifecycle of assigned eCommerce and Marketing websites using relevant CMS’ including Magento and WordPress
Quote project hours for potential and assigned projects
Maintain legacy sites and systems
Troubleshoot form submission issues on client sites
Write small pseudo-applications and improvements for client sites (ie: forms, jQuery brochure displays)
Schedule and perform basic security updates for current web & eCommerce sites
Debug customer applications, act as a liaison between product-specific support teams, and our clients
Discuss general disposition of graphics on a website and technology needs
Respond to Errors and issues on Hosted sites
Maintain World Class customer service, perception, and satisfaction for customers
Fast turnaround of customer requests
Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively
Enter all work and time in service management system
Effectively plan and prioritize work schedule
Additional Skills
Strong knowledge of PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, MySQL, jQuery
Experience with Angular/React and the MEAN/MERN stack
Experience using C#.Net, SQL Server, SharePoint
Experience developing with WordPress, Magento
Experience with LAMP stacks. Conversant in MySQL queries and backups.
Bachelor’s degree in related field
General Understanding of SSL implementation
Understanding of eCommerce principals as related to developing an eCommerce site
Excellent writing & communication skills
2-5 yrs industry experience
Basic experience with AJAX, JSON, REST design.
Basic experience with Model View Controller (MVC) programming
Company Description
World Synergy is a leading strategic integrated services firm in Cleveland, Ohio. For over 20 years, we have shaped integrated online marketing, application, and technology strategies to increase our clients’ sales and improve their ROI.
Our Technology group provides a total network managed services, application development, SharePoint development, Security Audits and computing infrastructure architecture expertise. From ensuring secure, reliable networks to setting a technology strategy, we support our clients and help their business grow. We were recently named one of the top 500 Managed Service Providers in the World.
Our Marketing group provides a full suite of traditional and digital marketing & advertising services including web development, SEO, SEM, design, analytics, email marketing and social media management to boost our clients’ online visibility and revenue.
Our Applications group develops custom platforms that seamlessly integrate with our clients’ processes to fit all their business needs and strategic goals. We understand the value in personalizing website platforms and mobile applications, which is why we use cutting-edge technology to shape these applications to the needs of our customers – and make them a work of art for their customers to use.
THE BENEFITS
Work Smart. Work Creatively. Work with Us.
Together, we work hard, work smart, and have fun. After all – it isn’t just “work” if you love what you do. Step inside and see for yourself.
Awesome Work Space. We moved in 2017 to an office that has an abundance of windows, meeting space, and upgraded appliances! We have plenty of room to grow in our new and updated space.
401(k) Savings Plan. Because we all dream of that moment we can finally sit back and put our feet up.
Healthcare & Benefits. If you have your health, you have everything. And we want you to always be on your A-game.
Short-Term Disability. We understand that sometimes, life gets in the way and things beyond work take priority. Short-term disability allows you to focus on you, so you can be your best self inside and outside of the office.
Competitive PTO. Find a work-life balance that allows you to make time for yourself and the things that excite you in your free time. We also have 8 national holidays off per year.
Opportunities to Attend Industry Events. Ongoing education is important to keep our team ahead of the curve, so we take advantage of industry events, seminars, and conferences when they present themselves.
Team Activities & Outings. Work hard, play hard is an attitude that can be expected. We would argue laughter is a great exercise… and mental health is important. So is team bonding.

title: Engineer, Software (OneData/Big Data Team)
description:
Job Description:
Engineer, Software (OneData/Big Data Team)
Description
This is an opportunity to become part of the OneData Big Data Team, which is a Network Performance and Operations Platform for elements of the T-Mobile Wireless Network. This is also an opportunity to work with many open source big data technologies and build applications for data at scale, Hadoop, Impala, Kudu, Kafka, and Spark. Ability to build custom web reporting applications for data at scale and leverage internal BI tooling, Qlik Sense, Power BI and Tableau. Ability to build and enable machine learning, AI and streaming use cases. Work with the most talented Hadoop team in T-Mobile building all tooling in house.
Enterprise Core Competencies
Requires competency in customer focus, change & innovation, strategic thinking, relationship building & influencing, talent management, results focus and inspirational leadership.
Responsibilities:
Essential Functions
Build distributed, scalable, and reliable data pipelines that ingest and process data at scale and in real-time.
Own product features from requirement review to production deployment.
Model, design, develop, code, test, debug, document and deploy application to production through standard processes.
Partner with other technology teams to deliver end to end solutions.
Conduct design & code reviews in a Continuous Deployment environment.
Technical System Expertise: Understands system protocols, how systems operate and data flows. Aware of current technology benefits. Expected to independently develop a full software stack. Understands the building blocks, interactions, dependencies, and tools required to complete software and automation work. Independent study of current technology is expected. Interact with system engineers to define system requirement and/or necessary requirements for automation.
Technical Engineering Services: Drives engineering projects by developing software solutions; conducting tests and inspections; preparing reports and calculations. Expected to supervise base and associate level engineers as needed.
Innovation: Contributes to designs to implement new ideas which improve an existing and new system/process/service. Contributes to designs to implement new ideas which utilize new frameworks to improve an existing or new system/process/service. Understands and can apply new industry perspectives to our existing business model. Review existing designs and processes to highlight more efficient ways to complete existing workload more effectively through industry perspectives. Understands the creation of company IPR.
Technical Writing: Maintains knowledge of existing technology documents. Writes basic documentation on how technology works. Creates clear documentation for new code and systems used. Documenting systems designs, presentations, and business requirements for consumption and consideration at the manager level. Understands the protection of company IPR.
Technical Leadership: Collaborates with technical teams and utilizes system expertise to deliver technical solutions. Continuously learns and teaches others existing and new technologies. Contributes to the development of others through mentoring or in-house workshops and learning sessions.
Technology Strategy: Contributes to new and existing technology options that support business goals.
Qualifications:
Minimum Required
Understanding of network monitoring systems, Architecture, Technologies and concepts.
Demonstrated technical writing and presentation skills
Self-motivated and able to work well under pressure
Must have good interpersonal skills and be able to build consensus across various teams
Experience with Cloudera Impala and Oracle DB operations and administration
Experience working in a Unix, or Linux environment (Redhat)
Experience with database optimization
Experience developing with PERL, C++, Java, Python or equivalent programming language
Experience with server and storage design for big data solutions
Experience with big data technologies, Hadoop, Hive, Impala, Scoop, HBase, Kafka, Spark
2+ years IT/Technical engineering experience
Desired
RF experience
Experience with designing performance management applications
Experience developing HTML5 web applications
Education
Bachelor's Degree
In lieu of a degree, experience within industry may be considered.
Minimum Qualifications:
At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States
High School Diploma or GED
Pre-employment background screen
Company Profile:
As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com
EOE Statement:
We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Java Developer (REF2411F)
description:
Job Description
As a Senior Programmer Analyst, you will collaborate with other developers, product managers, and QA to build a system for managing private equity investments. You will be part of a team responsible for implementing the full private equity investment lifecycle, using modern technologies including cloud infrastructure and blockchain, and supporting clients with a global scope. This will involve a mix of supporting existing logic and clients in production, while having many “greenfield” chances to create and implement new functionality in the system. We are looking for well-rounded developers who work well in a development team using iterative development methodologies to create robust, high-quality production systems.
Job Responsibilities
As part of the Development team, produce designs and estimates to deliver on functional requirements, while also owning the non-functional requirements that traditional Product Management teams typically struggle to define well (scalability requirements, HA/resiliency requirements, etc.)
Develop, test, debug and implement code for existing and new functionality
Perform full stack development using Java and SQL
Implement Smart Contracts on the Hyperledger blockchain in Go, and interface with the blockchain in Javascript
Review business and functional requirements provided by the Product Management team
Craft technical design documentation and contribute to technical design discussions that will result in new business or technical enhancements
Contribute roadmap and continually review existing architecture for improvements
Work in an Agile software development process, contributing to story and task creation
Work with QA to ensure high quality releases are delivered
Rapidly address issues and fix defects discovered during client implementations when needed
Work with our Information Security and other Governance teams to ensure we’re putting out a high quality, resilient, secure product that aligns with Broadridge development policies and controls.
Qualifications
6+ years of experience with Java based applications, including web application front end technologies.
Proven ability to have relevant conversations with Product Management to understand the feature roadmap and produce designs that meet those requirements.
Strong technical background; capable of understanding possible technical designs to the functional requirements, and recommending an approach that delivers high quality solutions, on time and within budget.
BS (or higher) degree in Computer Science, related degree, or comparable experience
Previous AWS experience crafting, developing, deploying, and supporting production cloud applications.
Deep understanding of blockchain technology (ideally Hyperledger)
Experience delivering and supporting applications that include modern web services (e.g. REST, Swagger, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with Azure
Prior production experience with Blockchain
Financial domain knowledge
Private Equity domain experience
Skills/Competencies
Strong interpersonal/communication skills (both written and verbal)
Consistent record for developing, releasing, and supporting multiple high quality products

Positive working attitude
Attention to detail
